## Decree-by-Law No. 117 of 2024
### Approving the Final Account of the Kuwait Institute for Scientific Research for the Fiscal Year 2020/2021

- Having reviewed the Constitution,
- And the Amiri Order issued on 2 Dhu al-Qi'dah 1445 AH, corresponding to 10 May 2024 AD,
- And Decree-by-Law No. (31) of 1978 regarding the rules for preparing public budgets, supervising their implementation, and the final account, and its amending laws,
- And Decree-by-Law No. (28) of 1981 establishing the Kuwait Institute for Scientific Research <orig>معهد الكويت للأبحاث العلمية</orig>,
- And Law No. (3) of 2003 concerning the procedures for issuing certain attached and independent budgets and their final accounts, and its amending Law No. 8 of 2015,
- And Law No. (62) of 2020 linking the budget of the Kuwait Institute for Scientific Research <orig>معهد الكويت للأبحاث العلمية</orig> for the fiscal year 2020/2021,
- And upon the proposal of the Minister of Finance <orig>وزير المالية</orig>,
- And after the approval of the Council of Ministers <orig>مجلس الوزراء</orig>,
- We have issued the following Decree-by-Law:

#### Article One
The total revenues in the final account of the Kuwait Institute for Scientific Research <orig>معهد الكويت للأبحاث العلمية</orig> for the fiscal year 2020/2021 amounted to KWD 5,671,931.

#### Article Two
The total expenditures in the final account of the Kuwait Institute for Scientific Research <orig>معهد الكويت للأبحاث العلمية</orig> for the fiscal year 2020/2021 amounted to KWD 43,758,996 (only forty-three million, seven hundred fifty-eight thousand, nine hundred ninety-six Kuwaiti Dinars <orig>دينار كويتي</orig>), as set forth in Schedule (B) attached to this Decree-Law.

#### Article Three
The total funding from the budget of ministries and government departments (Ministry of Finance <orig>وزارة المالية</orig> – General Accounts) for the final account of the Kuwait Institute for Scientific Research <orig>معهد الكويت للأبحاث العلمية</orig> amounted to KWD 38,087,065 (only thirty-eight million, eighty-seven thousand, and sixty-five Kuwaiti Dinars <orig>دينار كويتي</orig>), as set forth in Schedule (C) attached to this Decree-Law.

#### Article Four
The Prime Minister <orig>رئيس مجلس الوزراء</orig> and the Ministers – each within their respective jurisdiction – shall implement this Decree-Law, and it shall come into force from the date of its publication in the Official Gazette <orig>الجريدة الرسمية</orig>.

### Article Two
The net profits of the Corporation and its subsidiaries for the fiscal year 2020/2021, amounting to KWD 94,459,000 (ninety-four million, four hundred fifty-nine thousand Kuwaiti Dinars <orig>دينار كويتي</orig> only), shall be distributed as follows:
(1) KWD 9,445,900 (nine million, four hundred forty-five thousand, nine hundred Kuwaiti Dinars <orig>دينار كويتي</orig> only) as a general reserve for the Corporation.
(2) KWD 85,013,100 (eighty-five million, thirteen thousand, one hundred Kuwaiti Dinars <orig>دينار كويتي</orig> only) shall be transferred to the State's Public Treasury.
This is in accordance with Table No. (3) attached to this Decree-Law.

### Article Three
The Prime Minister and the Ministers – each within their respective jurisdictions – shall implement this Decree-Law, and it shall come into force from the date of its publication in the Official Gazette.

c- Funding from the budget of ministries and government departments (Ministry of Finance <orig>وزارة المالية</orig> – Public Accounts) for the fiscal year 2020/2021 amounted to KWD 19,357,653.839 (nineteen million, three hundred fifty-seven thousand, six hundred fifty-three Kuwaiti Dinars <orig>دينار كويتي</orig> and 839 fils only), in accordance with Schedule (C) attached to this Decree-Law.

d- An amount of KWD 1,500,000 (one million, five hundred thousand Kuwaiti Dinars <orig>دينار كويتي</orig> only) was allocated to the Zakat House <orig>بيت الزكاة</orig> as an annual subsidy from the budget of ministries and government departments (Ministry of Finance <orig>وزارة المالية</orig> – Public Accounts) for the fiscal year 2020/2021.

### Article Two

The Prime Minister and the Ministers – each within their respective jurisdiction – shall implement this Decree-Law, and it shall come into force from the date of its publication in the Official Gazette.

### Article Two
The net profits of the Corporation and its subsidiaries for the fiscal year 2021/2022, amounting to 1,206,929,000 KWD (one billion, two hundred and six million, nine hundred and twenty-nine thousand Kuwaiti Dinars <orig>دينار كويتي</orig> only), shall be distributed as follows:

This is in accordance with Table No. (3) attached to this Decree-Law.

### Article Three
The Prime Minister and the Ministers – each within their respective jurisdictions – shall implement this Decree-Law, and it shall come into force from the date of its publication in the Official Gazette.

- Having reviewed the Constitution,
- And the Amiri Order issued on 2 Dhu al-Qi'dah 1445 H, corresponding to 10 May 2024 G,
- And Decree-Law No. 31 of 1978 regarding the rules for the preparation of general budgets, supervision of their implementation, and the final account, and its amending laws,
- And Law No. (125) of 2019 concerning the regulation of insurance,
- And Law No. (45) of 2022 linking the budget of the Insurance Regulatory Unit for the fiscal year 2022/2023,
- And based on the proposal of the Minister of Finance,
- And after the approval of the Council of Ministers,
- We have issued the following Decree-Law:

### Article One
The final account of the Insurance Regulatory Unit <orig>وحدة تنظيم التأمين</orig> for the fiscal year 2022/2023 is approved as follows:
a- Revenues amounted to KWD 7,311,237.632 (seven million, three hundred eleven thousand, two hundred thirty-seven Kuwaiti Dinars <orig>دينارا كويتيا</orig> and 632 fils only), in accordance with Schedule (a) attached to this Decree-Law.
b- Expenditures amounted to KWD 2,273,883.400 (two million, two hundred seventy-three thousand, eight hundred eighty-three Kuwaiti Dinars <orig>دينارا كويتيا</orig> and 400 fils only), in accordance with Schedule (b) attached to this Decree-Law.

### Article Two
The excess of revenues over expenditures amounted to KWD 5,037,354.232 (five million, thirty-seven thousand, three hundred fifty-four Kuwaiti Dinars <orig>دينارا كويتيا</orig> and 232 fils only), in accordance with Schedule (c) attached to this Decree-Law, and shall be distributed as follows:
a- An amount of KWD 503,735.423 (five hundred three thousand, seven hundred thirty-five Kuwaiti Dinars <orig>دينارا كويتيا</orig> and 423 fils only), representing 10% of the year's savings, shall be transferred to the Unit.
b- An amount of KWD 4,533,618.809 (four million, five hundred thirty-three thousand, six hundred eighteen Kuwaiti Dinars <orig>دينارا كويتيا</orig> and 809 fils only) shall be transferred to the State's Public Treasury in accordance with Article (15) of Law No. 125 of 2019.

### Article Three
The Prime Minister and the Ministers—each within their respective jurisdictions—shall implement this Decree-Law, and it shall come into force from the date of its publication in the Official Gazette.

### Article Two
The net profit resulting from the excess of revenues over expenditures, amounting to KWD 327,847,863.773 (three hundred twenty-seven million, eight hundred forty-seven thousand, eight hundred sixty-three Kuwaiti Dinars <orig>دينار كويتي</orig> and 773 fils only), shall be distributed as follows:

- Transfer an amount of KWD 320,412,721.243 to the State's Public Treasury <orig>الخزانة العامة للدولة</orig>.
This is in implementation of the provision of Article (17) of Law No. (32) of 1968, and in accordance with Schedule (C) attached to this Decree-Law.

### Article Three
The Prime Minister <orig>رئيس مجلس الوزراء</orig> and the Ministers – each within their respective jurisdictions – shall implement this Decree-Law, and it shall come into force from the date of its publication in the Official Gazette <orig>الجريدة الرسمية</orig>.

The excess of revenues over expenditures, amounting to KWD 1,098,043,778.340 (One billion, ninety-eight million, forty-three thousand, seven hundred seventy-eight Kuwaiti Dinars <orig>دينار كويتي</orig> and 340 fils only), in accordance with Schedule (C) attached to this Decree-Law, shall be added to the funds' reserves.

### Article Three
The Prime Minister and the Ministers, each within their respective jurisdictions, shall implement this Decree-Law. It shall come into force from the date of its publication in the Official Gazette.

# Explanatory Memorandum for Decree-Law No. 155 of 2024 Approving the Memorandum of Understanding between the Government of the State of Kuwait and the Government of the People's Republic of China

Regarding Cooperation on the Mubarak Al-Kabeer Port Project and its Attached Protocol. In recognition of the common interests and development demands between the Government of the State of Kuwait and the Government of the People's Republic of China, and in order to strengthen cooperation between the two parties in the field of transport infrastructure, considering that cooperation on the Mubarak Al-Kabeer Port project will facilitate the synergy between the Chinese Belt and Road Initiative and Kuwait Vision 2035, all with the aim of deepening the practical and friendly cooperation between the two parties, a Memorandum of Understanding was signed between the Government of the State of Kuwait and the Government of the People's Republic of China regarding cooperation on the Mubarak Al-Kabeer Port project and its attached protocol.

The Memorandum of Understanding included eight paragraphs and an attached protocol amending Paragraph (5) of the Memorandum.
Paragraphs (1) and (2) defined the objectives and principles of cooperation between the two parties on the Mubarak Al-Kabeer Port project.
Paragraph (3) included the contents of cooperation agreed upon by the two parties, which consist of mutual consultations on the development direction, construction, and operation plans for the Mubarak Al-Kabeer Port; providing necessary support to companies from both countries; sharing laws, regulations, and policies related to the project; and any other areas agreed upon by the two parties.
Paragraph (4) enumerated the forms of cooperation agreed upon by the two parties, which include establishing a joint working group or a joint group of technical experts, organizing mutual visits and technical exchanges, exchanging information, materials, and recommendations related to the Mubarak Al-Kabeer Port project by both the Kuwaiti and Chinese sides, and any other forms of cooperation agreed upon by the two parties.
Paragraph (5), in accordance with the protocol attached to the memorandum, identified the implementing authorities for the Memorandum of Understanding on the Kuwaiti side as the Ministry of Public Works <orig>وزارة الأشغال العامة</orig>, and the contact points for the implementing authorities on the Kuwaiti side as the Committee for Following Up on the Executive Status of Agreements and Memoranda of Understanding Signed between the State of Kuwait and the People's Republic of China <orig>لجنة متابعة الموقف التنفيذي لاتفاقيات ومذكرات التفاهم الموقعة بين دولة الكويت وجمهورية الصين الشعبية</orig>.
As for the Chinese side, the implementing authorities will be the Ministry of Transport <orig>وزارة النقل</orig>, and the contact points for the implementing authorities will be the Department of International Cooperation at the Ministry of Transport.
Paragraph (6) obligated both parties to adhere to the intellectual property provisions of their respective countries and the relevant international agreements to which both parties are signatories, as well as to adhere to confidentiality provisions, such that neither party shall disclose any confidential information, documents, or data provided by the other party to a third party without the other party's consent.

## Memorandum of Understanding
Between the Government of the State of Kuwait and the Government of the People's Republic of China Concerning Cooperation on the Mubarak Al-Kabeer Port Project

The Government of the State of Kuwait and the Government of the People's Republic of China (hereinafter referred to as "the Parties"),
Recognizing the common interests and development demands of the Parties to strengthen cooperation between Kuwait and China in the field of transport infrastructure,
Considering that cooperation on the Mubarak Al-Kabeer Port project will facilitate the synergy between China's Belt and Road Initiative and Kuwait Vision 2035,
With the aim of deepening friendly and practical cooperation,
Have reached the following understanding:

### Paragraph 1 Cooperation Objectives
The Parties, through cooperation on the Mubarak Al-Kabeer Port, aim to establish a new anchor point that facilitates trade and commercial exchange between East and West, in order for the Mubarak Al-Kabeer Port project to become an early harvest project in the transport sector within the joint development process of the Belt and Road Initiative between Kuwait and China.

### Paragraph 2 Cooperation Principles
The Parties agree to support companies from both countries to establish mutually beneficial and win-win cooperation in accordance with market principles, on the basis of fairness and mutual benefit, and in accordance with their respective laws and regulations.

### Paragraph 3 Content of Cooperation
The contents of cooperation agreed upon between the Parties may include the following:
a- Mutual consultations on the development direction, construction plans, and operational plans for the Mubarak Al-Kabeer Port, and joint support for companies from both countries to implement the development, construction, and operation of the port.
b- Providing necessary support to companies from both countries in financing, investment, construction, and operation of the Mubarak Al-Kabeer Port project, including incentive measures such as preferential policies, in accordance with the national laws and regulations of their respective countries.
c- Sharing their respective laws, regulations, policies, practices, and experiences related to the development, construction, and operation of ports.
d- Other areas agreed upon by the Parties.

### Paragraph 4 Forms of Cooperation
The forms of cooperation agreed upon between the Parties may include the following:
a- Establishing a joint working group or a joint group of technical experts.
b- Organizing mutual visits and technical exchanges.
c- The Kuwaiti side providing information and materials related to the Mubarak Al-Kabeer Port project to the Chinese side, and the Chinese side recommending Chinese companies with credentials and capabilities to the Kuwaiti side for the purpose of participating in the implementation of the Mubarak Al-Kabeer Port project.
Companies from both countries will decide on commercial follow-up matters through consultations according to market principles.
d- Other forms of cooperation agreed upon by the Parties.

### Paragraph 5 Implementation
1- The implementing authorities for this Memorandum of Understanding are:
For the Kuwaiti side - The Development Agency for Silk City (Al-Subiya) and Boubyan Island <orig>جهاز تطوير مدينة الحرير (الصبية) وجزيرة بوبيان</orig>.
For the Chinese side - The Ministry of Transport.
2- The points of contact for the implementing authorities of the Parties are:
For the Kuwaiti side - The Development Agency for Silk City (Al-Subiya) and Boubyan Island <orig>جهاز تطوير مدينة الحرير (الصبية) وجزيرة بوبيان</orig>.
For the Chinese side - The Department of International Cooperation of the Ministry of Transport.

### Paragraph 6 Intellectual Property and Confidentiality
1- The Parties shall support their respective countries' laws and regulations concerning the protection of intellectual property rights and the relevant international agreements to which both Parties are signatories, during the process of implementing this Memorandum of Understanding or other agreements reached by the Parties in accordance with this Memorandum of Understanding.
2- Neither Party shall disclose or publish any confidential documents, information, or data provided by the other Party, or derived from the implementation of this Memorandum of Understanding, to a third party without the consent of the other Party.

### Paragraph 7 Rights, Obligations, and Dispute Settlement
1- This Memorandum of Understanding is not an international agreement and shall not create any international legal rights or obligations, except for those related to confidentiality stipulated in Paragraph 6.

2- Any disputes arising during the implementation of this Memorandum of Understanding shall be settled by the two Parties through amicable consultations.

### Article 8: Entry into Force, Validity, Amendments, and Termination
1- The two Parties shall notify each other in writing, through diplomatic channels, of the completion of their necessary internal legal procedures required for this Memorandum of Understanding to enter into force. This Memorandum of Understanding shall enter into force 30 days after the receipt of the second notification. The validity of this Memorandum of Understanding shall be for a period of 5 years.
2- In the event that neither Party receives a written notification from the other Party of its intention to terminate this Memorandum of Understanding 6 months prior to its expiration date, the validity of this Memorandum of Understanding shall be automatically renewed for a successive period or periods of five years.
3- This Memorandum of Understanding may be amended at any time by mutual written consent of the two Parties. The amendments shall enter into force in accordance with the provisions stipulated in sub-paragraph 1 of this Article.
4- Either Party may notify the other Party in writing, through diplomatic channels, of its intention to terminate this Memorandum of Understanding. This Memorandum of Understanding shall be terminated 6 months after the date of receipt of the notification by the other Party. The termination of this Memorandum of Understanding shall not affect the implementation of the confidentiality obligations stipulated in Article 6 of this Memorandum of Understanding.

Signed in the city of Hangzhou, on September 22, 2023, corresponding to Rabi' al-Awwal 7, 1445 H, in two original copies, in the Arabic, Chinese, and English languages, all texts being equally authentic. In case of any discrepancy in the interpretation of the texts, the English text shall prevail.

### Embassy of the People's Republic of China
**Reference:** 24530
**Date:** December 3, 2024

The Embassy of the People's Republic of China in the State of Kuwait presents its compliments to the esteemed Ministry of Foreign Affairs (Asia Department) of the State of Kuwait, and with reference to the esteemed Ministry's note No. 8/23984 dated September 24, 2024, the Embassy has the honor to state that Article (8) of the Memorandum of Understanding between the Government of the People's Republic of China and the Government of the State of Kuwait on Cooperation in the Mubarak Al-Kabeer Port <orig>ميناء مبارك الكبير</orig> project provides:
1- The two Parties shall notify each other in writing, through diplomatic channels, of the completion of their necessary internal legal procedures required for this Memorandum of Understanding to enter into force. This memorandum shall enter into force 30 days after the receipt of the second notification. The validity of this Memorandum of Understanding shall be for a period of 5 years.
3- This Memorandum of Understanding may be amended at any time by mutual written consent of the two Parties. The amendments shall enter into force in accordance with the provisions stipulated in sub-paragraph 1 of this Article.

In accordance with the above, the Chinese Ministry of Transport has confirmed that it has no objection to the Kuwaiti side's proposal to amend Article (5) to read as follows:
1. The implementing authority for the Memorandum of Understanding for the Kuwaiti side – the Ministry of Public Works <orig>وزارة الأشغال العامة</orig>.
2. The points of contact for the implementing authorities of the Kuwaiti side – the Committee for Following up on the Executive Status of Agreements and Memoranda of Understanding Signed between the State of Kuwait and the People's Republic of China.

The Embassy would be grateful if the esteemed Ministry would address the concerned authorities, complete the necessary internal procedures, and provide the Embassy with a written response. It should be noted that the relevant amendments will enter into force 30 days after the Chinese side receives the written notification.

The Embassy avails itself of this opportunity to renew to the esteemed Ministry the assurances of its highest consideration and respect.

**Attachment:** Copy of the esteemed Ministry's note No. 8/23984 dated September 24, 2024
**Contact:** Mr. Wu Donghui <orig>وو دونغهوي</orig> 60383199

</image>## MEMORANDUM OF UNDERSTANDING BETWEEN THE GOVERNMENT OF THE STATE OF KUWAIT AND THE GOVERNMENT OF THE PEOPLE'S REPUBLIC OF CHINA ON COOPERATION IN MUBARAK AL-KABEER PORT PROJECT

The Government of The State of Kuwait and The Government of The People's Republic of China (hereinafter referred to as the 'Participants')

Recognizing the common interests and development demands of the Participants to strengthen cooperation between Kuwait and China in the field of transport infrastructure,

Considering the cooperation in Mubarak Al-kabeer Port Project will facilitate the synergy of the Belt and Road Initiative of the Chinese side and the 2035 Vision of Kuwait,

With a view to deepening the cordial pragmatic cooperation,

Have reached the following understanding:

### PARAGRAPH I
**COOPERATION OBJECTIVES**

The Participants are aiming at, through the cooperation in Mubarak Al-kabeer Port, forging a new fulcrum that will facilitating the commerce and trade between the East and the West, so as to make the Mubarak Al-kabeer Port Project become the Early Harvest Project in the transport sector in the process of the joint development of the Belt and Road Initiative between Kuwait and China.
<page_end>82</page_end>

### PARAGRAPH II
**COOPERATION PRINCIPLES**

The Participants agreed to support enterprises from both countries to carry out mutual beneficial and win-win cooperation with market principles on the basis of equality and mutual benefit and in accordance with their respective laws and regulations.

### PARAGRAPH III
**COOPERATION CONTENTS**

The cooperative contents agreed by the Participants may include:

a. mutual consultations on the development orientation, construction plans and operation plans of Mubarak Al-kabeer Port, and joint support to enterprises from both countries to implement the development, construction and operation of the port;

b. provision of necessary supports to enterprises from both countries in the financing, investment, construction and operation of Mubarak Al-kabeer Port Project, including incentive measures such as preferential policies, according to the national laws and regulations of their respective countries;

c. sharing each other's laws, regulations, policies, practices and experiences relevant to the development, construction and operation of ports;

d. and other areas agreed by the Participants.

### PARAGRAPH IV FORMS OF COOPERATION

The forms of cooperation agreed by the Participants may include:

a. setting up a Joint Working Group or a Joint Technical Expert Group;

b. organizing exchange visits and technical exchanges;

c. the provision of the relative information and materials of Mubarak Al-kabeer Port Project by the Kuwaiti side to the Chinese side; and the recommendation of Chinese companies with credits and capabilities by the Chinese side to the Kuwaiti side for the purpose of the participation in the implementation of Mubarak Al-kabeer Port Project. The follow-up commercial issues will be decided by the companies from both countries through consultations with market

 and other forms of cooperation agreed by the Participants.

## PARAGRAPH V IMPLEMENTATION
1. The implementation bodies of this MoU of the Participants are:
for the Kuwaiti side – Silk City and Boubyan Island Development Authority;
for the Chinese side – Ministry of Transport.
2. Contact points of the implementation bodies of the Participants are:
for the Kuwaiti side – Silk City and Boubyan Island Development Authority;
for the Chinese side – Department of International Cooperation of the Ministry of Transport.

## PARAGRAPH VI INTELLECTUAL PROPERTY RIGHT AND CONFIDENTIALITY
1. The Participants will abide by the laws and regulations of their respective countries on intellectual property right protection and the relevant international treaties joined by both Participants in the process of the implementation of this MoU or other agreements reached by the Participants according to this MoU.
2. Without the consent of the other Participant, one Participant will not release or distribute any confidential documents, information and data provided by the other Participant, or derived from the implementation of this MoU, to a third party.

## PARAGRAPH VII RIGHTS, OBLIGATIONS AND DISPUTE SETTLEMENT
1. This MoU is not an international treaty, and will not create any international legitimate rights or obligations, except those of confidentiality stipulated in Paragraph VI.
2. Any disputes arise during the implementation of this MoU will be settled down by the Participants through cordial consultations.

## PARAGRAPH VIII EFFECTIVENESS, VALIDITY, AMENDMENTS AND TERMINATION
1. The Participants will notify each other in writing, through diplomatic channels, of the completion of their necessary internal legal procedures required for the effectiveness of this MoU. This MoU will become effective thirty days after the receipt of the second notification. This MoU will remain valid for a period of five years.
2. If the Participants do not receive the notification in writing of the other Participant of its intention to terminate this MoU six months before the expiry date of this MoU, the validity of this MoU will be renewed automatically for a successive period or periods of five years.
3. This MoU may be amended at any time with mutual consent in writing by the Participants. The amendments will become effective in accordance with the provisions stipulated in Sub-paragraph 1 of this Paragraph.
4. One Participant will notify the other Participant in writing, through diplomatic channels, of its intention to terminate this MoU. This MoU will become invalid six months since the date of the receipt of the notification by the other Participant. The termination of this MoU will not affect the implementation of the obligations of confidentiality stipulated in Paragraph VI of this MoU.

Signed in Hangzhou on the 22nd September 2023 corresponding to the 7th Rabi'a Al-Awwal 1445 AH in original duplicate, in Arabic, Chinese, and English, with all of the texts considered being equally authentic. In the case of any discrepancy in the interpretation of the texts, the English text shall prevail.

**Article (12)**
((The university shall have a full-time director for its administration, appointed by decree at the excellent grade <orig>الدرجة الممتازة</orig> upon the proposal of the Minister for a term of four years, renewable once. ## Second Article

# Explanatory Memorandum for Decree-Law No. 156 of 2024 Amending Certain Provisions of Law No. (76) of 2019 Concerning Public Universities

Given the importance of the position of University Director <orig>مدير الجامعة</orig> in accordance with the competencies and powers vested in it by Law No. 76 of 2019 concerning Public Universities, and taking into consideration that the University Director will be full-time to perform and carry out these duties, it was deemed appropriate to reconsider the method of selecting the person to occupy this position. The appointment shall be by decree for a term of four years, renewable once, upon the proposal of the Minister of Higher Education and Scientific Research <orig>وزير التعليم العالي والبحث العلمي</orig>, and from among the academic staff of the university who hold the rank of professor and possess the necessary scientific and administrative experience to carry out the duties of this position. In the event that the university is newly established and its academic staff has not yet been formed, the scope of selection shall be expanded so that the University Director may be chosen from among the academic staff either within or outside this newly established university, and the appointment shall be subject to the same provisions regarding the appointment of a University Director in terms of the instrument and duration of the appointment.

In light of the foregoing, and as a consequence thereof, Clause No. (5) of Article (9) of the aforementioned Law No. 76 of 2019 has been reformulated by deleting the competence of the Council of Public Universities <orig>مجلس الجامعات الحكومية</orig> to set the conditions required for nomination to the position of University Director and their deputies. Clause No. (12) of Article (9) and Clause No. (33) of Article (11) of the aforementioned law have also been deleted. The first of these stipulated the announcement of a vacancy for the position of Public University Director and the opening of applications, while the second stipulated the formation of a selection committee for the University Director by the University Council. This is because the selection will now be made by the competent Minister. It was also deemed appropriate to delete the second paragraph of Article (14) of the same law, which specified that the university's internal regulations shall determine the method of selecting the Deputy University Director <orig>نائب مدير الجامعة</orig> and their competencies, and to make the decision issued by the University Director the determinant of these competencies.

Given the issuance of the Amiri Order on 10/5/2024, Article (4) of which stipulates that laws shall be issued by decree-laws, the present draft Decree-Law has been prepared to amend certain provisions of the aforementioned Law No. 76 of 2019. Its first article provides for the replacement of the text of Clause No. (5) of Article (9) and Article (12) of the aforementioned law.
The second article of the present draft Decree-Law provides for the repeal of Clause No. (12) of Article (9), Clause No. (33) of Article (11) of the aforementioned Law of 2019, the repeal of the second paragraph of Article (14) of this law, and the repeal of any provision that contradicts the provisions of this Decree-Law. Meanwhile, the third article of the draft Decree-Law obligates the ministers – each within their respective jurisdiction – to implement the provisions of this Decree-Law, and stipulates that it shall come into force from the date of its publication in the Official Gazette.

# Decree No. 221 of 2024
## Regarding the revocation of Kuwaiti nationality from an individual

- Having reviewed the Constitution,
- And the Amiri Order issued on 2 Dhu al-Qi'dah 1445 H, corresponding to May 10, 2024 G,
- And Amiri Decree No. 15 of 1959 concerning the Kuwaiti Nationality Law, and its amending laws,
- And upon the submission of the First Deputy Prime Minister and Minister of Interior,
- And with the approval of the Council of Ministers,

**We have decreed the following**

### Article One
The Kuwaiti nationality shall be revoked from / Rakan Mohammed Khetlan Rawi Al-Anzi <orig>راكان محمد ختلان راوي العنزي</orig>, and from those who may have acquired it with him by dependency.

### Article Two
The First Deputy Prime Minister and Minister of Interior shall implement this decree, and it shall come into force from the date of its issuance and be published in the Official Gazette.

# Decision of the Council of Ministers <orig>مجلس الوزراء</orig>
## No. 1537 of 2024
### Regarding the Withdrawal of Kuwaiti Citizenship Certificates from Certain Individuals
The Council of Ministers <orig>مجلس الوزراء</orig>
- Having reviewed the Constitution,
- And Amiri Decree <orig>الأمر الأميري</orig> issued on 2 Dhu al-Qi'dah 1445 AH, corresponding to May 10, 2024 CE,
- And Article (21 bis "A") of Amiri Decree <orig>المرسوم الأميري</orig> No. 15 of 1959 regarding the Kuwaiti Nationality Law <orig>قانون الجنسية الكويتية</orig>, and its amending laws,
- And based on the submission of the First Deputy Prime Minister <orig>النائب الأول لرئيس مجلس الوزراء</orig> and Minister of Interior <orig>وزير الداخلية</orig>,
Has decided

In the Name of His Highness the Amir of the State of Kuwait
Sheikh Mishal Al-Ahmad Al-Jaber Al-Sabah <orig>الشيخ مشعل الأحمد الجابر الصباح</orig>
The Supreme Wisdom
Bankruptcy Department <orig>إدارة الإفلاس</orig>
## Decision
On Thursday, 2024/12/26, at the headquarters of the Bankruptcy Department <orig>إدارة الإفلاس</orig>, with the membership of Mr. Bandar Al-Dhafiri <orig>بندر الظفيري</orig>, Bankruptcy Judge <orig>قاضي الإفلاس</orig>, and in the presence of Mr. Abdul Aziz Al-Ateeq <orig>عبد العزيز العتيق</orig>, Secretary, regarding Application No.: 2023/10 Preventive Settlement <orig>تسوية وقائية</orig>, registered under automated number: 234284150
Submitted by: Al-Bahsali Sweets Company <orig>شركة حلويات البحصلي</orig> - Limited Liability Company.
Against /
1- Al-Marasi Al-Oula General Trading and Contracting Company <orig>شركة المراسي الأولى للتجارة العامة والمقاولات</orig>.
2- Al-Majmoua Al-Alamiya Al-Oula for Automobiles Company <orig>شركة المجموعة العالمية الأولى للسيارات</orig>.
3- Adam Investment Holding Company <orig>شركة أدم للاستثمار القابضة</orig>.
4- Star Line Transport Company <orig>شركة ستار لاين للنقل</orig>.

After reviewing the application documents:
Whereas the brief facts of the case are that the applicant company - a limited liability company - was established on 2001/6/2, and in light of the amendments made to the company's articles of association, the last of which was on 2006/3/18, the company's capital became 800,000 KWD (eight hundred thousand Kuwaiti Dinars). Al-Mafia Real Estate Company <orig>الشركة المافية العقارية</orig> owns a quarter of the shares therein, while Ifad Real Estate Company <orig>شركة إيفاد العقارية</orig> owns the remaining capital. As global financial crises have affected the country, many companies have suffered losses as a result, including the applicant company. The company's debts amounted to 1,494,880.153 KWD (one million, four hundred ninety-four thousand, eight hundred eighty Dinars and 153 Fils). However, the applicant company owns the right of usufruct <orig>حق الانتفاع</orig> in two industrial plots in the Subhan Industrial Area <orig>منطقة صبحان الصناعية</orig> valued at 2,300,000 KWD (two million, three hundred thousand Dinars), in addition to the oldest trademark in Kuwait, valued at 200,000 KWD.

### Article One
The Kuwaiti nationality certificate shall be withdrawn from those mentioned below, and Kuwaiti nationality shall be withdrawn from anyone who acquired it through dependency on the holder of that certificate:
1- Munir Awad Jabran Mohammed Al-Ajmi <orig>منير عوض جبران محمد العجمي</orig>.
2- Ayed Awad Jabran Mohammed Al-Ajmi <orig>عايض عوض جبران محمد العجمي</orig>.
3- Hadi Awad Jabran Mohammed Al-Ajmi <orig>هادي عوض جبران محمد العجمي</orig>.
4- Salah Faisal Mohammed Saniheet Sanitan Al-Mutairi <orig>صلاح فيصل محمد صنيهيت صنيتان المطيري</orig>.
5- Saleh Faisal Mohammed Saniheet Sanitan Al-Mutairi <orig>صالح فيصل محمد صنيهيت صنيتان المطيري</orig>.
### Article Two
The First Deputy Prime Minister <orig>النائب الأول لرئيس مجلس الوزراء</orig> and Minister of Interior <orig>وزير الداخلية</orig> shall implement this decision, and it shall be effective from the date of its issuance and published in the Official Gazette <orig>الجريدة الرسمية</orig>.

The applicant company had obtained the approval of the majority of creditors for the preventive settlement plan, whose debts are estimated at an amount of KWD 1,367,885.300 (one million, three hundred sixty-seven thousand, eight hundred eighty-five Kuwaiti Dinars <orig>دينار كويتي</orig> and 300 fils) of the company's total debts.

The applicant company had submitted a request to the Bankruptcy Department <orig>إدارة الإفلاس</orig> to initiate preventive settlement procedures on 21/12/2023, and paid the due fee for it.

The requesting company had outlined in its request a summary of the proposed preventive settlement and the agreements intended to be concluded with the creditors regarding the settlement. It clarified its desire to be granted sufficient time to settle its outstanding debts in order to preserve the company's entity, the value of its assets, and the interests of its shareholders, while affirming its ability to settle all those debts.

The applicant company had attached to its request the documents required to initiate the preventive settlement procedures, as stipulated in the provisions of Law No. 71/2020 regarding Bankruptcy and its Executive Regulations, the most important of which are: 1- The company's amended articles of association and commercial register. 2- A brief explanation of the proposed preventive settlement plan. 3- The financial statements of the applicant company for the previous three years. 4- An extract of the judicial rulings issued against the applicant company and the enforcement measures taken against it. 5- The resolution of the Extraordinary General Assembly approving the submission of the request to initiate preventive settlement procedures. 6- Data of the creditors and the value of each debt.

Whereas the Bankruptcy Judge <orig>قاضي الإفلاس</orig> issued his decision dated 28/2/2024 addressing the Bankruptcy Committee <orig>لجنة الإفلاس</orig> to provide an opinion on the current request. The Committee's opinion, dated 7/4/2004, was received, which concluded that a preventive settlement is possible.

Whereas the Bankruptcy Judge <orig>قاضي الإفلاس</orig> issued his decision dated 28/4/2024 to initiate the preventive settlement procedures regarding the request submitted by the aforementioned company, with a stay on all judicial claims and enforcement measures taken against it for a period of three months from the date of that decision.

Whereas the Bankruptcy Judge <orig>قاضي الإفلاس</orig> issued his decision dated 1/7/2024 setting the date for the first meeting to approve the proposed preventive settlement for Monday, 15/7/2024, while tasking the applicant company with notifying the creditors and the Bankruptcy Committee <orig>لجنة الإفلاس</orig> of that date in accordance with the legally prescribed deadlines and procedures.

Whereas on the day scheduled for the first meeting to vote on the proposed preventive settlement, the applicant company obtained the legally required majority to approve the proposal.

Whereas the representative of Al-Mawashi Real Estate Company <orig>شركة الماشية العقارية</orig> – one of the owners of the applicant company – appeared before the Bankruptcy Judge <orig>قاضي الإفلاس</orig> and submitted a request to appoint a trustee from the list of licensed auditors at the Capital Markets Authority <orig>هيئة أسواق المال</orig> to preserve the company's assets. This was accompanied by a recommendation not to ratify the proposed preventive settlement submitted by Al-Hasli Sweets Company <orig>شركة حلويات الحصلي</orig> and to cancel the preventive settlement procedures.

The representative of Al-Mawashi Real Estate Company <orig>شركة الماشية العقارية</orig> also appeared and submitted appeal statement No. 2660/2024 Commercial Civil Government/1, filed on 24/6/2024, challenging the decision of the Bankruptcy Judge <orig>قاضي الإفلاس</orig> issued on 28/4/2024 to initiate the preventive settlement procedures regarding the request submitted by Al-Hasli Sweets Company <orig>شركة حلويات الحصلي</orig>. In its conclusion, it requested a ruling to stay the execution of the appealed decision until the appeal is adjudicated, to appoint a trustee to preserve the company's assets, and, on the merits, to annul the appealed decision and rule to reject the request. The appealing company based its appeal on the grounds that the decision was issued based on incorrect documents and was intended to harm the appealing company, as it owns 25% of the applicant company's capital and is a creditor to it by virtue of final judgments. It argued that the purpose of the submitted preventive settlement request is the liquidation of the requesting company and the sale of all its assets, especially since some of the debts presented by the requesting company are fabricated, considering that some of the companies mentioned as creditors are subsidiaries of the applicant company, owned, managed, and whose board of directors is controlled by the same majority that owns the applicant company or their affiliates, which introduces fraud and deceit into the submitted request. Furthermore, the applicant company deliberately concealed the appealing company's debt, in addition to violating the requirements mentioned in the Bankruptcy Law when submitting the preventive settlement request, and that the applicant company did not notify the appealing company of the preventive settlement request nor did it notify it of the date of the meeting scheduled to vote on the proposed preventive settlement. He submitted a portfolio of documents containing: a- A certificate of extract from the commercial register of Ifad Real Estate Company <orig>شركة إيفاد العقارية</orig>.

Data for each of: Adham Investment Holding Company <orig>شركة أدهم للاستثمار القابضة</orig>, Al-Marasi Al-Oula General Trading and Contracting Company <orig>شركة المراسي الأولى للتجارة العامة والمقاولات</orig>, First International Automobile Group Company <orig>شركة المجموعة العالمية الأولى للسيارات</orig>, Rafad Hotel Management Company <orig>شركة رفاد لإدارة الفنادق</orig>.

Whereas the Bankruptcy Judge <orig>قاضي الإفلاس</orig> issued the decision dated 29/7/2024 to suspend the ratification of the proposed preventive settlement submitted by the requesting company, pending the issuance of the judgment in appeal No. 2660/2024 Commercial Civil Government/1.

Whereas the representative of the requesting company submitted a letter dated 4/11/2024 requesting the resumption of the preventive settlement procedures, following the issuance of the judgment in the appeal challenge No. 2660/2024 Commercial Civil Government/1 in the session of 20/10/2024, in which it was ruled that the appeal was inadmissible in form for being filed through a procedure other than that prescribed by law.

Whereas the Bankruptcy Administration <orig>إدارة الإفلاس</orig> notified the applicant company of the submission by Al-Hashemiya Real Estate Company <orig>شركة الهاشمية العقارية</orig> for review and response to its contents.

Whereas the agent of the applicant company appeared and submitted a defense memorandum, concluding with a request to rule for the rejection of the objection submitted by Al-Hashemiya Real Estate Company <orig>شركة الهاشمية العقارية</orig>. He also submitted a portfolio of documents, which was reviewed.

Whereas on 2024/11/24, the Bankruptcy Judge <orig>قاضي الإفلاس</orig> instructed the applicant company to submit the articles of incorporation and their amendments, and the commercial register for the following companies: 1–Al-Marasi Al-Oula for General Trading and Contracting Company <orig>شركة المراسي الأولى للتجارة العامة والمقاولات</orig>. 2–First International Group for Automobiles Company <orig>شركة المجموعة العالمية الأولى للسيارات</orig>. 3–Adam for Investment Holding Company <orig>شركة آدم للاستثمار القابضة</orig>. 4–Rafad for Hotel Management Company <orig>شركة رفاد لإدارة الفنادق</orig>. 5–Al-Bait Al-Ma'mour Trading Company <orig>شركة البيت المعمور التجارية</orig>. 6–Arwa International for Printing Works Company <orig>شركة أروى العالمية لأعمال الطباعة</orig>. 7–Rahal International Company <orig>شركة رحال العالمية</orig>. 8–Ifad Real Estate Company <orig>شركة إيفاد العقارية</orig>.

Whereas the agent of the applicant company appeared and submitted a portfolio of documents containing the aforementioned required documents.

Legal Basis:
Whereas it is established by the text of Articles (1, 26, 33, 77, 79, 81, 82, 83, 84) of the Bankruptcy Law <orig>قانون الإفلاس</orig> No. 71/2020 that: "For the application of the provisions of this law, the following words and phrases shall have the meanings indicated next to each:

.. Preventive Settlement <orig>التسوية الوقائية</orig>: Procedures aimed at an agreement between the debtor and its creditors on a preventive settlement proposal in accordance with the provisions of this law. .. Required Majority <orig>الأغلبية المطلوبة</orig>: The majority required to consider a matter presented at a creditors' meeting as approved, which is achieved if the following conditions are met: 1–The attendance of the affected creditor or creditors representing at least more than half of the affected debts at the meeting where the vote will take place. 2–The approval of the creditor or creditors holding two-thirds of the debts represented at the meeting. 3–The approval of the numerical majority of the affected creditors after excluding related parties from voting at the meeting .. Related Party <orig>طرف ذو علاقة</orig>..

B–If the debtor is a legal person <orig>شخصا اعتباريا</orig>: 1–The person who has control, whether directly or indirectly, over the debtor. 2–The debtor's subsidiary company <orig>الشركة التابعة</orig>. 3–A company that is a member of the same group to which the debtor belongs. 4–A member of the debtor's board of directors or a member of the executive management. 5–A company under the control, joint control <orig>السيطرة المشتركة</orig>, or significant influence <orig>التأثير الهام</orig> of the persons referred to in item (4) of this definition, through their significant voting power, directly or indirectly. When determining a related party, what is stated in the International Accounting Standards <orig>معايير المحاسبة الدولية</orig> in this regard shall be taken into account. Significant Influence <orig>التأثير الهام</orig>: Is established when a company owns—directly or indirectly—a stake of 20% or more in another company, unless it is proven that it has no influence over it .. " "The Bankruptcy Administration <orig>إدارة الإفلاس</orig> shall notify the debtor of the application within ten days from the date of its submission if it was submitted by another party .. The Bankruptcy Administration <orig>إدارة الإفلاس</orig> shall also, during the period referred to in the first paragraph, notify the creditors whose data are listed in the application, and any of them may respond to the application within ten days from the date of being notified." "The Bankruptcy Administration <orig>إدارة الإفلاس</orig> shall, within ten days from the date of the issuance of the Bankruptcy Judge's <orig>قاضي الإفلاس</orig> decision to commence, reject, or dismiss the proceedings, publish, announce, and notify the concerned parties of the decision, and disclose it on Boursa Kuwait (Kuwait Stock Exchange) <orig>بورصة الكويت للأوراق المالية</orig> if the debtor is listed therein, and instruct the debtor to disclose it on its website, unless the Bankruptcy Judge <orig>قاضي الإفلاس</orig> decides to suffice with any of these or other methods. The Bankruptcy Judge <orig>قاضي الإفلاس</orig> may decide to announce the decision in a daily newspaper published in a foreign country if a significant portion of the debtor's creditors, assets, or business is in that country, or for any other reason the Bankruptcy Judge <orig>قاضي الإفلاس</orig> deems appropriate. In all cases, the decision issued to commence the proceedings must be registered within the period specified in this article."

"The right to vote on the preventive settlement proposal <orig>مقترح التسوية الوقائية</orig> is limited to the creditors affected by the proposal, and no party related to the debtor may participate in the vote .. The Bankruptcy Judge <orig>قاضي الإفلاس</orig> shall rule on any dispute that arises regarding a creditor's right to vote and who presides over the meeting, by a decision issued within ten days from the date of submitting a request to that effect to the Bankruptcy Administration <orig>إدارة الإفلاس</orig>." "The preventive settlement proposal <orig>مقترح التسوية الوقائية</orig> shall be deemed to have met the creditors' approval if the required majority approves it. If the proposal does not obtain the approval of this majority in the first creditors' meeting, the meeting shall be postponed for a period of ten days for a second meeting to be held to vote on the proposal .." "The debtor is obligated, within ten days from the date of approval or rejection of the preventive settlement proposal <orig>مقترح التسوية الوقائية</orig> .. In the event the proposal is rejected, the Bankruptcy Judge <orig>قاضي الإفلاس</orig> shall, within ten days from the date of notification from the Bankruptcy Administration <orig>إدارة الإفلاس</orig>, issue a decision to terminate the preventive settlement proceedings and dismiss the application. He may, upon the request of the debtor, the regulatory authority, or the creditors, decide to commence restructuring proceedings <orig>إجراءات إعادة الهيكلة</orig> or declare bankruptcy <orig>شهر الإفلاس</orig>, as he deems appropriate for the debtor's situation and the creditors' interests." "The Bankruptcy Judge <orig>قاضي الإفلاس</orig> shall, within ten days from the date the Bankruptcy Administration <orig>إدارة الإفلاس</orig> receives notification of the creditors' approval of the preventive settlement proposal <orig>مقترح التسوية الوقائية</orig> and its attachments, ratify the proposal after verifying the fulfillment of the following two conditions: 1–That the proposal has obtained the approval of the required majority. 2–That the proposal meets the fairness standards for the affected creditors as stipulated in the following article." "The preventive settlement proposal <orig>مقترح التسوية الوقائية</orig> shall be deemed to meet the fairness standards if the following are met: 1–The creditors have received sufficient information and adequate time to study the preventive settlement proposal <orig>مقترح التسوية الوقائية</orig>. 2–Non-violation of the creditors' meeting and voting procedures contained in the preventive settlement proposal <orig>مقترح التسوية الوقائية</orig> presented to the Bankruptcy Administration <orig>إدارة الإفلاس</orig> before the commencement of the preventive settlement proceedings. 3–Consideration of the existing rights of the creditors .." "The Bankruptcy Judge <orig>قاضي الإفلاس</orig> shall issue a decision to refuse to ratify the proposal or to suspend its ratification in the event of the realization of Ayman evictions of rented houses.

... or the voting procedures therein... 1- If the procedures for calling the meeting or the voting procedures therein are flawed by nullity. 2- If the proposal does not meet the standards of fairness according to the preceding article.. In the event of suspending the ratification of the proposal, the bankruptcy judge <orig>قاضي الإفلاس</orig> shall specify the amendments required to be made to it or the procedure required to be fulfilled, and shall set a deadline for the debtor to obtain the required majority approval for the amended proposal and resubmit it to the Bankruptcy Department <orig>إدارة الإفلاس</orig> for ratification. If the amended proposal obtains the required majority approval, the bankruptcy judge <orig>قاضي الإفلاس</orig> shall ratify it. In the event of creditors not approving the amended proposal, the bankruptcy judge <orig>قاضي الإفلاس</orig> shall issue a decision rejecting the ratification."
Based on the foregoing, (Al-Bahsalabi Sweets Company <orig>شركة حلويات البحصلبي</orig>) had submitted a request to initiate preventive settlement <orig>التسوية الوقائية</orig> procedures, on the grounds that it had incurred losses as a result of global financial crises, and the company's debts amounted to KWD 1,494,880.153 (one million four hundred ninety-four thousand eight hundred eighty dinars and 153 fils). However, it is capable of settling its obligations if the preventive settlement proposal submitted by it is approved, especially since it obtained the approval of the majority of creditors on the preventive settlement plan, whose debts are estimated at KWD 1,367,885.300 (one million three hundred sixty-seven thousand eight hundred eighty-five Kuwaiti dinars and 300 fils) of the company's total debts. The debtor company <orig>الشركة المدينة</orig> attached the required documents to its request. The Bankruptcy Department <orig>إدارة الإفلاس</orig> had commenced examining the request submitted by the aforementioned company and verifying its compliance with the form and requirements stipulated in the Bankruptcy Law <orig>قانون الإفلاس</orig>. The bankruptcy judge <orig>قاضي الإفلاس</orig> issued a decision to initiate preventive settlement <orig>التسوية الوقائية</orig> procedures, with a suspension of judicial claims and enforcement procedures taken against the company for a period of three months starting from 2024/4/28. The debtor company <orig>الشركة المدينة</orig> had submitted the preventive settlement proposal <orig>مقترح التسوية الوقائية</orig> and its annexes to present it to the creditors and obtain the legally required majority approval for the preventive settlement proposal. The meeting with the creditors was held under the supervision of the bankruptcy judge <orig>قاضي الإفلاس</orig>, and the debtor company <orig>الشركة المدينة</orig> obtained the required majority approval for the proposal with the presence and approval of each of the following:
1- Al-Marasi Al-Oula General Trading and Contracting Company <orig>شركة المراسي الأولى للتجارة العامة والمقاولات</orig>.
2- Al-Majmoua Al-Alamiya Al-Oula for Automobiles Company <orig>شركة المجموعة العالمية الأولى للسيارات</orig>.
3- Rahal International Cargo Transport Company <orig>شركة رحال العالمية لنقل البضائع</orig>.
4- Al-Bait Al-Maamour Commercial Company <orig>شركة البيت المعمور التجارية</orig>.
5- Arwa International Printing Works Company <orig>شركة أروى العالمية لأعمال الطباعة</orig>.
6- Adham Holding Company <orig>شركة أدهم القابضة</orig>.
Given this, Al-Mashia Real Estate Company <orig>الشركة الماشية العقارية</orig> - owner of 25% of the debtor company's <orig>الشركة المدينة</orig> capital - had submitted a request for a report of non-ratification of the submitted preventive settlement proposal <orig>مقترح التسوية الوقائية</orig>, exemption from preventive settlement <orig>التسوية الوقائية</orig> procedures, and rejection of the request. This was based on the premise that the applicant company <orig>الشركة مقدمة الطلب</orig> had based its request on incorrect documents, including that some of the debts presented by the applicant company <orig>الشركة الطالبة</orig> are fabricated debts, considering that some of the companies mentioned as creditor companies are subsidiaries owned, managed, and whose boards of directors are controlled by the same majority that owns the applicant company <orig>الشركة مقدمة الطلب</orig> or their affiliates, which introduces fraud and deception into the submitted request. Furthermore, the applicant company <orig>الشركة مقدمة الطلب</orig> deliberately concealed the debt of Al-Mashia Real Estate Company <orig>شركة الماشية العقارية</orig>, in addition to violating the requirements mentioned in the Bankruptcy Law <orig>قانون الإفلاس</orig>

when submitting the preventive settlement request <orig>طلب التسوية الوقائية</orig>. Moreover, the applicant company <orig>الشركة الطالبة</orig> did not notify the aforementioned company of the submitted preventive settlement request <orig>طلب التسوية الوقائية</orig> nor of the scheduled meeting date for voting on the preventive settlement proposal <orig>مقترح التسوية الوقائية</orig>. The bankruptcy judge <orig>قاضي الإفلاس</orig> had instructed the applicant company <orig>الشركة مقدمة الطلب</orig> to provide the articles of association and their amendments, and the commercial register for the following companies:
1- Al-Marasi Al-Oula General Trading and Contracting Company <orig>شركة المراسي الأولى للتجارة العامة والمقاولات</orig>.
2- Al-Majmoua Al-Alamiya Al-Oula for Automobiles Company <orig>شركة المجموعة العالمية الأولى للسيارات</orig>.
3- Adham Investment Holding Company <orig>شركة أدهم للاستثمار القابضة</orig>.
4- Rafad Hotel Management Company <orig>شركة رفاد لإدارة الفنادق</orig>.
5- Al-Bait Al-Maamour Commercial Company <orig>شركة البيت المعمور التجارية</orig>.
6- Arwa International Printing Works Company <orig>شركة أروى العالمية لأعمال الطباعة</orig>.
7- Rahal International Company <orig>شركة رحال العالمية</orig>.
8- Ifad Real Estate Company <orig>شركة ايفاد العقارية</orig>.
It was established from reviewing the articles of association and their amendments, and the commercial register for all creditor companies, that Ifad Real Estate Company <orig>شركة ايفاد العقارية</orig> - which owns three-quarters of the debtor company's <orig>الشركة المدينة</orig> capital - is owned by each of:
1- Mohammed Yousef Al-Roumi <orig>محمد يوسف الرومي</orig>.
2- Najeeb Abdulaziz Al-Humaidhi <orig>نجيب عبدالعزيز الحميضي</orig>.
3- Waleed Abdulaziz Al-Humaidhi <orig>وليد عبدالعزيز الحميضي</orig>,
and that Al-Marasi Al-Oula General Trading and Contracting Company <orig>شركة المراسي الأولى للتجارة العامة والمقاولات</orig> is owned by each of:
1- Ifad Real Estate Company <orig>شركة ايفاد العقارية</orig> - Mohammed Yousef Al-Roumi <orig>محمد يوسف الرومي</orig> & Partners.
2- Mohammed Yousef Al-Roumi <orig>محمد يوسف الرومي</orig>.
3- Waleed Abdulaziz Al-Humaidhi <orig>وليد عبدالعزيز الحميضي</orig>.
4- Mariam Abdullah Al-Khaled <orig>مريم عبد الله الخالد</orig>.
5- Najeeb Abdulaziz Al-Humaidhi <orig>نجيب عبدالعزيز الحميضي</orig>,
and that Al-Majmoua Al-Alamiya Al-Oula for Automobiles Company <orig>شركة المجموعة العالمية الأولى للسيارات</orig> has been managed by Mr. Moath Al-Yahya <orig>معاذ اليحيا</orig> since 2021/11/28 after the dismissal of Mr. Essa Yousef Al-Shamlan <orig>عيسى يوسف الشملان</orig>. And that Adham Investment Holding Company (K.S.C.C.) <orig>شركة أدهم للاستثمار القابضة (ش.م.ك.م)</orig> is owned by each of:
1- Ifad Real Estate Company <orig>شركة ايفاد العقارية</orig>.
2- Mohammed Yousef Al-Roumi <orig>محمد يوسف الرومي</orig>.
3- Najeeb Abdulaziz Al-Humaidhi <orig>نجيب عبدالعزيز الحميضي</orig>.
4- Razah Mohammed Al-Roumi <orig>رزاح محمد الرومي</orig>,
and that Rafad Hotel Management and Trading in its Special Materials Company <orig>شركة رفاد لإدارة الفنادق والاتجار بالمواد الخاصة بها</orig> - Mohammed Yousef Al-Roumi <orig>محمد يوسف الرومي</orig> & Partners is owned by each of:
1- Najeeb Abdulaziz Al-Humaidhi <orig>نجيب عبدالعزيز الحميضي</orig>.
2- Ghanem Abdulrahman Al-Ghanem <orig>غانم عبدالرحمن الغانم</orig>.
3- Mohammed Yousef Al-Roumi <orig>محمد يوسف الرومي</orig>,
and that Rahal International Cargo Transport Company <orig>شركة رحال العالمية لنقل البضائع</orig> - Essa Al-Shamlan <orig>عيسى الشملان</orig> & Partners is owned by each of:
1- Essa Yousef Al-Shamlan <orig>عيسى يوسف الشملان</orig>.
2- Mohammed Yousef Al-Roumi <orig>محمد يوسف الرومي</orig>.
3- Rahal Logistics Company <orig>شركة رحال اللوجستية</orig>.
Given this, and it was stipulated according to the Bankruptcy Law <orig>قانون الإفلاس</orig> that the bankruptcy judge's <orig>قاضي الإفلاس</orig> ratification of the preventive settlement proposal <orig>مقترح التسوية الوقائية</orig> depends on the proposal obtaining the legally required majority approval and meeting the standards of fairness for creditors in terms of creditors receiving sufficient information and adequate time to study the preventive settlement proposal <orig>مقترح التسوية الوقائية</orig>, and that the procedures for the creditors' meeting and voting contained in the proposal are legally sound, while observing the existing rights of creditors. Furthermore, it is stipulated according to the Bankruptcy Law <orig>قانون الإفلاس</orig> that the bankruptcy judge <orig>قاضي الإفلاس</orig> must issue a decision rejecting the request or suspending its ratification if the procedures for calling the meeting or the voting procedures therein are flawed by nullity, or if the proposal does not meet the pre-established standards of fairness. It was established from the documents that Ifad Real Estate Company <orig>شركة ايفاد العقارية</orig>, which controls the debtor company <orig>الشركة المدينة</orig> by owning three-quarters of its capital, is an owner in the following creditor companies:
1- Al-Marasi Al-Oula General Trading and Contracting Company <orig>شركة المراسي الأولى للتجارة العامة والمقاولات</orig>.
2- Adham Investment Holding Company (K.S.C.C.) <orig>شركة أدهم للاستثمار القابضة (ش.م.ك.م)</orig>.
It was also established that all owners of Ifad Real Estate Company <orig>شركة ايفاد العقارية</orig>, namely:
1- Mohammed Yousef Al-Roumi <orig>محمد يوسف الرومي</orig> (his heirs thereafter).
2- Najeeb Abdulaziz Al-Humaidhi <orig>نجيب عبدالعزيز الحميضي</orig>.
3- Waleed Abdulaziz Al-Humaidhi <orig>وليد عبدالعزيز الحميضي</orig>,
own shares in the following creditor company: Al-Marasi Al-Oula General Trading and Contracting Company <orig>شركة المراسي الأولى للتجارة العامة والمقاولات</orig>. It was also established that some owners of Ifad Real Estate Company <orig>شركة ايفاد العقارية</orig>, namely:
1- Mohammed Yousef <orig>محمد يوسف</orig>

**Decided**

**Article One:**
The license of Al-Kuwaitiya Newspaper <orig>الصحيفة الكويتية</orig> shall be revoked by operation of law, pursuant to Clause (1) of Article (14) of Law No. 3 of 2006 concerning Publications and Publishing, as referred to.

**Article Two:**
The competent authorities shall implement this decision, which shall be published in the Official Gazette <orig>الجريدة الرسمية</orig>, and concerned parties shall be notified by registered mail with acknowledgment of receipt.

Assistant Undersecretary <orig>وكيل الوزارة المساعد</orig>
for the Press, Publishing, and Printed Materials Sector <orig>لقطاع الصحافة والنشر والمطبوعات</orig>

Issued on: 29 Jumada Al-Akhira 1446 AH
Corresponding to: 30 December 2024 CE

Al-Roumi <orig>الرومي</orig>. 2- Najib Abdulaziz Al-Humaidhi <orig>نجيب عبدالعزيز الحميضي</orig>, own shares in each of the following creditor companies: 1- Adeem Investment Holding Company (K.S.C.C.) <orig>شركة أديم للاستثمار القابضة (ش.م.ك.م)</orig>. 2- Rifad Hotel Management and Trading in its Special Materials Company – Mohammed Yousef Al-Roumi & Partners <orig>شركة رفاد لإدارة الفنادق والاتجار بالمواد الخاصة بها – محمد يوسف الرومي وشركاه</orig>. It was also established that one of the owners of Ifad Real Estate Company <orig>شركة إيفاد العقارية</orig>: Mohammed Yousef Al-Roumi <orig>محمد يوسف الرومي</orig>, owns shares in the following creditor company: Rahhal International Cargo Transport Company – Essa Al-Shamlan & Partners <orig>شركة رحال العالمية لنقل البضائع – عيسى الشملان وشركاه</orig>. It was also established that the former manager of the debtor company, Mr. Essa Yousef Al-Shamlan <orig>عيسى يوسف الشملان</orig> – until 17/10/2021 – owns shares in the creditor company: Rahhal International Cargo Transport Company – Essa Al-Shamlan & Partners <orig>شركة رحال العالمية لنقل البضائع – عيسى الشملان وشركاه</orig>. From this, it is concluded that the aforementioned creditors are related parties <orig>أطراف ذوو علاقة</orig> to the debtor company, which renders their vote at the meeting for approving the preventive settlement proposal invalid, thus requiring the exclusion of their attendance and the proportion of their debts from the meeting held to approve the submitted preventive settlement proposal. It was established from the documents – as previously stated – that the debtor company did not obtain the required majority approval for its submitted preventive settlement proposal – considering that the creditor companies whose votes were excluded constitute the majority of the creditor companies present at that meeting, and they own more than two-thirds of the debts represented at the meeting, as the debt of Al-Marasi Al-Oula General Trading and Contracting Company <orig>شركة المراسي الأولى للتجارة العامة والمقاولات</orig> alone amounts to 1,132,541.829 K.D. <orig>د.ك.</orig>.
Furthermore, all remaining creditor companies – which are not considered related parties to the debtor company – do not achieve the majority attendance or voting required for the preventive settlement proposal. Consequently, in light of this, the current preventive settlement request has failed to obtain legal majority approval, and has reached its legally prescribed limit, which entails the issuance of a decision to reject it. This leads the bankruptcy judge <orig>قاضي الإفلاس</orig> to decide to reject the proposal, terminate the preventive settlement procedures, and archive the request submitted by the debtor company as will be stated.

Therefore, we have decided the following:
To reject the preventive settlement request submitted by the debtor company (Al-Hasamli Sweets Company – Limited Liability Company <orig>شركة حلويات الحصملي – شركة ذات مسؤولية محدودة</orig>) and terminate the preventive settlement procedures, while archiving the request in the electronic register of the Department, and obliging the company to bear its expenses. The Bankruptcy Department <orig>إدارة الإفلاس</orig> shall notify the debtor company, the creditors, and the Bankruptcy Committee <orig>لجنة الإفلاس</orig> of this decision in accordance with Article (55) of Bankruptcy Law No. 71/2020, and publish it in the Official Gazette <orig>الجريدة الرسمية</orig>.
Pursuant to Article (8) of the Bankruptcy Law <orig>قانون الإفلاس</orig>, decisions issued by the bankruptcy judge <orig>قاضي الإفلاس</orig> shall be executive instruments <orig>سندات تنفيذية</orig> in accordance with this law, and the Bankruptcy Department <orig>إدارة الإفلاس</orig> shall affix the enforcement formula <orig>الصيغة التنفيذية</orig> to them, and they shall be enforceable immediately upon their issuance without prior announcement.

Secretary
Bankruptcy Judge <orig>قاضي الإفلاس</orig>

**Article Two:**
Appendix No. (1) Inter-Funds <orig>الصناديق البينية</orig> shall be added to Book Eighteen (Inter-Registration of Financial Products <orig>التسجيل البيني للمنتجات المالية</orig>) of the Executive Regulations of Law No. (7) of 2010 regarding the Establishment of the Capital Markets Authority <orig>هيئة أسواق المال</orig> and the Regulation of Securities Activity and their amendments, in accordance with Attachment No. (2) to this Resolution.

**Article Three:**
Appendix No. (4) Table of Authority Service Fees <orig>جدول رسوم خدمات الهيئة</orig> from Book Two (Capital Markets Authority <orig>هيئة أسواق المال</orig>) of the Executive Regulations of Law No. (7) of 2010 regarding the Establishment of the Capital Markets Authority <orig>هيئة أسواق المال</orig> and the Regulation of Securities Activity and their amendments shall be amended in accordance with Attachment No. (3) to this Resolution.

**Article Four:**
The competent authorities shall implement this Resolution, each within its jurisdiction, and it shall be effective from 2025/1/5 and published in the Official Gazette <orig>الجريدة الرسمية</orig>.

Chairman of the Board of Commissioners of the Capital Markets Authority <orig>هيئة أسواق المال</orig>
Prof. Dr. Ahmed Abdulrahman Al-Mulhem <orig>أحمد عبدالرحمن الملحم</orig>

Issued on: December 29, 2024 AD

<table_caption>Attachment No. (1): Details of Amendments</table_caption>
<table>

| 1. | One | Definitions | — | Addition of a definition | — | Inter-Fund <orig>الصندوق البيني</orig>: Any fund or collective investment scheme, established, licensed, or regulated by any of the regulatory authorities in the Gulf Cooperation Council <orig>دول مجلس التعاون لدول الخليج العربية</orig> countries, and managed by a licensed person for specified fees. |
| 2. | One | Definitions | — | Amendment of a definition | Promoter <orig>الشخص المروج</orig>: A licensed person or a person subject to the supervision of any of the regulatory authorities who applies to promote their financial product on an inter-jurisdictional basis. | Promoter <orig>الشخص المروج</orig>: A person licensed by the Authority to carry out the activity of a collective investment scheme manager or an underwriting agent (selling) and who conducts inter-jurisdictional promotion activities in the State of Kuwait <orig>دولة الكويت</orig> after obtaining permission from the Authority. |
| 3. | Eighteen | Two | 1-2 | Amendment of an article | Inter-Jurisdictional Promotion Obligations: The Promoter <orig>الشخص المروج</orig> or the entity appointed for inter-jurisdictional promotion must not commence inter-jurisdictional promotion of any financial product in any of the regulatory authorities in the Gulf Cooperation Council <orig>دول مجلس التعاون لدول الخليج العربية</orig> countries except after fulfilling the conditions and obligations stipulated in this Book, and specifically the following: 1. They must possess human, technical, and financial capabilities and resources sufficient to fulfill their obligations. 2. Exercise the diligence of a prudent person in carrying out the tasks assigned to promoting their financial product, and bear responsibility for any professional negligence, omission, or fraud committed by them during the performance of their work, and compensate any person who suffers damage as a result of any error committed by them, provided that the Authority, whether it is the registered regulatory authority or the host regulatory authority, is notified within ten days. | Inter-Jurisdictional Promotion Obligations: The Promoter <orig>الشخص المروج</orig> or the entity appointed for inter-jurisdictional promotion must not commence inter-jurisdictional promotion of any financial product in any of the regulatory authorities in the Gulf Cooperation Council <orig>دول مجلس التعاون لدول الخليج العربية</orig> countries except after fulfilling the conditions and obligations stipulated in this Book. |

<br>3. To immediately take all necessary steps to rectify any failure in its obligations stipulated in this Book or any instructions issued by the Authority.
<br>4. To take all necessary steps regarding the submission of complaints and grievances by clients.
<br>5. To notify the Authority and clients immediately upon the occurrence of material events or information that would jeopardize clients' interests, as soon as it becomes aware of them.
<br>6. To provide the client with proof of ownership in the financial investment to enable them to exercise all rights arising therefrom.
<br>7. To prepare and maintain a register of clients for whom it has promoted in the State of Kuwait <orig>دولة الكويت</orig>.
<br>8. To provide the Authority with any data requested directly or through other regulatory bodies, and to appear before it in investigations, before the Complaints and Grievances Committee, or the Disciplinary Board whenever summoned, and to implement sanctions if issued.
<br>9. Any other obligations or conditions determined by the Authority.
These obligations apply to the promoter or the entity appointed for environmental promotion, even if the license period for the environmentally registered financial product has expired, until it provides the Authority with proof of the exit of all clients for whom it marketed in the State of Kuwait <orig>دولة الكويت</orig>.
<table>
| 4. | Eighteenth | Third (Environmental Registration Funds) | Article 3-1 | Addition of Article | - | **Scope of Application**<br>The provisions of this Chapter apply to environmentally registered funds or those applying for environmental registration for the purpose of promoting their units in one of the Gulf Cooperation Council <orig>مجلس التعاون لدول الخليج العربية</orig> countries.<br>The provisions of Chapter One and Chapter Two of this Book, Environmental Registration Regulations and the Regulatory Framework for Environmental Registration, also apply to them in matters not specifically addressed in this Chapter. |
| 5. | Eighteenth | Third | Article 3-2 | Addition of Article | - | **National Funds Licensed by the Authority**<br>A fund – licensed by the Authority for its establishment – may submit an application to the Authority for environmental registration of the fund in the register of financial products to promote its units with any of the regulatory bodies, provided that the following controls are met: |
| 6. | Eighteenth | Third | Article 3-2-1 | Addition of Article | - | 1. The application for environmental registration of the fund shall be submitted according to the form provided in Annex No. (1) (Environmental Fund Registration Form) of Appendix No. (1) of this Book, provided that all documents and information specified in this form are attached to the application, and the prescribed fee is paid.<br>2. The Authority shall decide on the application after receiving it complete with all required information and documents, within a maximum period of ten working days from the date of its complete submission. In case of a decision to approve or reject the application, the host regulatory body and the fund manager must be notified within ten working days from the date of its issuance. The fund manager may not engage in any environmental promotion activities with the host regulatory body based on this notification unless the application has been finally decided upon by the host regulatory body.<br>3. In case of rejection of the application, the rejection decision must be reasoned. The Authority may, before issuing the rejection decision, notify the fund manager to address the reasons for rejection, and the fund manager must complete any deficiencies within ten working days from the date of such notification, otherwise the application will be rejected.<br>4. The host regulatory body shall decide on the fund registration application within a period not exceeding ten working days from the date of receiving the notification from the Authority. It may extend this period for another similar period for further study.<br>5. The host regulatory body shall notify the Authority of its decision to approve or reject the fund registration application. In case of rejection, the rejection decision must be reasoned. |

| Environmental promotion of the fund is not permitted except in accordance with the promotional advertisement controls stipulated in Chapter Seven of Book Eight (Business Ethics) of these Regulations, and specifically, without using any public advertising means in promotional activities, including advertisements, articles, or any means of addressing the public or publishing in newspapers, magazines, news media, or broadcasting on visual, audio, or print media, or social media, and without holding introductory workshops or meetings with prospective investors unless they are directed only to professional clients concerned with the private offering. Obtaining final environmental registration permission from the Authority, without prejudice to the preceding paragraph, allows for the use of electronic means and electronic trading platforms to display and promote environmental fund units or to execute subscription and redemption requests without the need for the investor to personally attend the licensed person's premises, and without prejudice to the investor's fundamental rights, including their access to the fund's Articles of Association. | - | Addition of Article | Article 3-3 | Third | Eighteenth | 11. |
|---|---|---|---|---|---|---|
| Registration of the Environmental Fund for the Promotion of its Units in the State of Kuwait <orig>دولة الكويت</orig> | - | Addition of Article | Article 3-4 | Third | Eighteenth | 12. |
| The fund is registered environmentally for the promotion of its units in the State of Kuwait <orig>دولة الكويت</orig> according to the following steps: <br> 1. An environmental fund registration notification is submitted by the registered regulatory body in accordance with the forms contained in Appendix No. (1) of this Book, provided that all documents and information specified in this form are attached to the application, and the prescribed fee is paid. <br> 2. The Authority may, at any time after receiving the environmental registration notification that meets the requirements according to Clause (1) of this Article, request from the fund manager or the registered regulatory body any additional information or documents it deems necessary to decide on the application. <br> 3. The fund manager must submit the required information and documents to the Authority within a maximum period of ten working days from the date of notification thereof, otherwise the application shall be deemed null and void. <br> 4. The Authority shall decide on the environmental registration application after receiving the application complete with all information and documents specified in this Article within a maximum period of ten working days, and it may extend this period for another similar period for further study. <br> 5. In the event of initial approval of the environmental registration application, the registered regulatory body and the fund manager shall be notified of the Authority's decision, and the fund manager shall pay the prescribed fees within a maximum period of one month from the date of issuance of the approval referred to in this clause. <br> 6. In case of rejection of the application, the rejection decision must be reasoned, and the registered regulatory body and the fund manager shall be notified of the Authority's decision within the periods stipulated in Clause No. (4) of this Article. <br> 7. The Authority shall issue the final permission for the environmental fund upon completion of the requirements stipulated in this Article, with notification to the registered regulatory body and the fund manager of the final approval decision and its effective date. The environmental promoter may not accept any subscription/participation request in the fund before obtaining this permission. The applicant must meet the periods prescribed in this Article, otherwise the application shall be deemed null and void. | - | Addition of Article | Article 3-4-1 | Third | Eighteenth | 13. |
| The Authority may exempt the fund manager from including some data and information contained in the environmental fund prospectus referred to in Annex No. (2) (Environmental Fund Prospectus) of Appendix No. (1) of this Book if it deems that the disclosure of this information would conflict with the public interest. | - | Addition of Article | Article 3-4-2 | Third | Eighteenth | 14. |
| Unless the environmental fund enters liquidation, the permission issued by the Authority for the promotion and registration of the environmental fund remains valid for one year from the date of its grant, and may be renewed for a similar period or periods upon a request submitted by the fund manager in accordance with the procedures of Article (3-4-1) of this Chapter. <br> Renewal of the permission issued by the Authority for the promotion and registration of the environmental fund is not required if there is no desire to promote additional units after the expiration of the permission period. <br> In all cases, the fund shall continue its relations with unit holders who have subscribed/participated in the environmental fund, even if the permission period has expired, until their complete exit from the fund. | - | Addition of Article | Article 3-4-3 | Third | Eighteenth | 15. |
