<td>Third</td>
<td>Article 3-4</td>
<td>Addition of Article</td>
<td>—</td>
<td>**Obligations of the Promoter**<br>The Promoter <orig>الشخص المروج</orig> shall be obligated to the following:<br>1. To operate in accordance with the law, this regulation, circulars, decisions, and instructions issued by the Authority <orig>الهيئة</orig>, the environmental registration regulatory framework, environmental registration regulations, and the articles of association or prospectus of the Environmental Fund <orig>الصندوق البيئي</orig>.<br>2. To exercise the diligence of a prudent person in performing the tasks assigned to him, and to compensate any person who suffers damage as a result of any error committed by him while performing the environmental promotion tasks stipulated in this Article, provided that the Authority <orig>الهيئة</orig> is notified within five working days of the occurrence of any of the cases stipulated in this clause.<br>3. Not to exceed the environmental promotion quota approved by the Authority <orig>الهيئة</orig> unless the Authority's <orig>الهيئة</orig> approval is obtained for increasing the marketing quota during the environmental registration period and the prescribed fee is paid for that.<br>4. To deliver to the subscriber proof of their subscription or ownership in the Environmental Fund <orig>الصندوق البيئي</orig> to enable them to exercise all rights arising from their ownership.<br>5. To prepare and maintain a register of unit holders who have subscribed/participated in the Environmental Fund <orig>الصندوق البيئي</orig> from the State of Kuwait <orig>دولة الكويت</orig> in accordance with the requirements of Article (2-2) of this Book.<br>6. To notify the Authority <orig>الهيئة</orig> of any material events affecting the Environmental Fund <orig>الصندوق البيئي</orig> or the rights of unit holders, if available or known to him.<br>7. To deal with complaints submitted against the Promoter <orig>الشخص المروج</orig> by unit holders who have subscribed/participated in the Environmental Fund <orig>الصندوق البيئي</orig> from the State of Kuwait <orig>دولة الكويت</orig> and ensure their appropriate and prompt resolution.<br>8. To provide an appropriate means for conveying complaints submitted against the Fund Manager <orig>مدير الصندوق</orig> by unit holders who have subscribed/participated in the Environmental Fund <orig>الصندوق البيئي</orig> and to endeavor to deliver them to the relevant authority as quickly as possible.<br>9. To submit a report on the results of the subscription/participation in the Environmental Fund <orig>الصندوق البيئي</orig> within fifteen working days from the end date of the environmental registration period or if marketing operations are completed before that (whichever is earlier).<br>10. Not to exploit the assets of the Environmental Fund <orig>الصندوق البيئي</orig> for personal gain.<br>11. To provide any other data or documents requested by the Authority <orig>الهيئة</orig>.</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>17</td>
<td>Eighteenth</td>
<td>Third</td>
<td>Article 3-5</td>
<td>Addition of Article</td>
<td>—</td>
<td>**Financial Products Register**<br>The Authority <orig>الهيئة</orig> and the Host Regulatory Body <orig>الجهة المنظمة المستضيفة</orig> shall establish a register for financial products, including approved funds, which shall contain the following:<br>1. Name of the registered regulatory body and the name(s) of the Host Regulatory Body/Bodies <orig>الجهة/الجهات المنظمة المستضيفة</orig>.<br>2. Name of the Environmental Fund <orig>الصندوق البيئي</orig>, its headquarters, and address.<br>3. Type of Environmental Fund <orig>الصندوق البيئي</orig>, whether private or public.<br>4. Name of the Fund Manager <orig>مدير الصندوق</orig>, its headquarters, and address.<br>5. Name of the Promoter <orig>الشخص المروج</orig>.<br>6. Date of registration of the Environmental Fund <orig>الصندوق البيئي</orig> from the commencement of the environmental registration approval's validity.<br>The Authority <orig>الهيئة</orig> shall publish the decisions for establishing the register in the Official Gazette <orig>الجريدة الرسمية</orig>, and the Fund Manager <orig>مدير الصندوق</orig> shall notify the Authority <orig>الهيئة</orig> and the Host Regulatory Body <orig>الجهة المنظمة المستضيفة</orig> of any amendment made to the register data contained in this Article within a maximum period of 7 working days from its occurrence.</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>18</td>
<td>Eighteenth</td>
<td>Third</td>
<td>Article 3-6</td>
<td>Addition of Article</td>
<td>—</td>
<td>**Transfer of Ownership**<br>Without prejudice to the provisions regulating the Environmental Fund <orig>الصندوق البيئي</orig> with the regulatory bodies, the Promoter <orig>الشخص المروج</orig> may transfer the ownership of Environmental Fund <orig>الصندوق البيئي</orig> units to unit holders in the State of Kuwait <orig>دولة الكويت</orig> during or after the expiry of the license period, based on a justified request from the unit holder or concerned parties, provided that the Promoter <orig>الشخص المروج</orig> is responsible for verifying the applicability of one of the following cases:<br>1. Restructuring of the unit holder's assets.<br>2. Cases of mortgage or attachment, provided they do not conflict with their regulating provisions.<br>3. Transfer of ownership to relatives up to the second degree.<br>4. Cases of ownership transfer based on an enforceable judicial judgment.<br>5. Cases of ownership transfer based on inheritance or will.</td>
</tr>

| Eighteenth | Third | Article 3-7 | Addition of an article | - | In all cases, the licensed person shall notify the Authority within fifteen business days of the completion of the ownership transfer process with a report that includes the parties to the ownership transfer, the number of units and their value, and the justifications for the ownership transfer. It is prohibited to use the ownership transfer to market the units of the environmental fund to new subscribers in the State of Kuwait after the expiration of the promotion permit issued by the Authority. |
| 20. | Eighteenth | Third | Article 3-8 | Addition of an article | - | **Complaints and Disputes**<br>In the event of any disputes between the fund manager or the promoter and the unitholders of the environmental fund, these disputes shall be resolved in accordance with the fund's articles of association and the applicable legislation of both the registered regulatory authority or the host regulatory authority, as the case may be. |
| 21. | Eighteenth | Third | Article 3-8-1 | Addition of an article | - | **Deregistration of the Environmental Fund**<br>The Authority may suspend the promotion of units of any of the funds subject to its supervision in the jurisdictions of the host authorities, or suspend the promotion of units of funds subject to the supervision of other regulatory authorities in its jurisdiction in the following cases:<br>1. Non-compliance by the fund manager or the promoter with the provisions of this Book.<br>2. Upon a written request from the fund manager.<br>3. Upon the commencement of the environmental fund's liquidation procedures.<br>4. Violation of the national or public interest, or if the promotion results in harm to the unitholders or to the financial stability in its jurisdiction.<br>5. For any other reasons deemed appropriate by the Authority.<br>In the event of suspension, the fund's registration shall be deregistered from the register of financial products, and the other regulatory authorities, the fund manager, and the promoter shall be immediately notified of the deregistration and the reasons that led to it. |
| 22. | Eighteenth | Third | Article 3-8-2 | Addition of an article | - | The promoter shall immediately cease the environmental promotion of the fund's units upon the fund's deregistration from the register of financial products. This deregistration shall not affect the rights and obligations of the unitholders who have subscribed to the environmental fund before the date of deregistration. |
</table>

2. Country of origin (the state in which the Fund was established).
3. The registered regulatory body/supervisory body/regulatory authority (the authority to whose laws the Fund is subject).
4. Fund Manager's details: (The person specialized in managing the Fund's investments).
    a. The name of the Fund Manager, with a statement that they are licensed to manage the environmental fund by the registered regulatory body, and the registration or license number, if any.
    b. The jurisdiction in which the Fund Manager was established and the date of its establishment.
    c. Its address, website, and contact information.
    d. The names of the members of the Fund Manager's board of directors or other management officials and a brief curriculum vitae for each.
    e. If the Fund Manager is a subsidiary of a parent company, the name of the parent company and the state or territory in which that parent company was established must be stated.
    f. A statement of parties related or connected to the Fund Manager.
    g. The value of the Fund Manager's capital shares and the paid-up portion thereof.
    h. A summary of the material provisions of the contract concluded between the Fund and the Fund Manager that may be of concern to unitholders, including provisions related to exemption, compensation upon cancellation, and indemnity.
5. The percentage of the Fund Manager's participation in the Fund's capital.
6. The Fund's date of establishment.
7. The Fund's duration.
8. The Fund's classification (public/private).
9. The Fund's currency.
10. The Fund's capital.
11. The Fund's structure (open-ended/closed-ended).
12. The legal form of the Fund, and whether or not it has an independent legal personality.
13. The nature of the Fund (conventional/compliant with the provisions of Islamic Sharia).
14. The type of Fund.
15. Investment objectives.
16. Investment policy, restrictions, and controls.
17. A summary of the investment (if the investment is predetermined in the articles of association).
18. The nominal value of the unit.
19. The characteristics and number of units in the Fund, which must include information regarding the following:
    a. The Fund's units that have been issued or are available for issuance and their appurtenant rights, to the extent that such rights differ from the rights associated with other classes of units in the Fund.
    b. How unitholders can exercise their voting rights and the nature of those rights.
    c. The circumstances in which any unit may be required to be mandatorily redeemed, amortized, or converted from one class to another, if any.
20. The offer price of the unit to be marketed within the State of Kuwait.
21. A statement of the minimum initial subscription (if any).
22. Investment risks.
23. Borrowing powers and limits, and any operational restrictions related to the use of debt (if any).
24. The dates and mechanism for the valuation of the Fund's assets and units, and the periodic reports that will be provided to unitholders.
25. The calculation periods for the unit price (NAV), if any.
26. Transaction details, which must include the following:
    a. The method for subscribing to, purchasing, and redeeming the Fund's units and transferring their ownership.
    b. Dealing days, periods, and deadlines for subscription and redemption.
    c. The circumstances and periods in which payment deferral or suspension of unit redemption may be applied.
27. The method and basis for profit distribution (if any).
28. The minimum/maximum subscription and redemption by the Fund Manager and the unitholders in the Fund.

# Decision No. (171) of 2024
Regarding a private marketing license for a collective investment scheme established outside the State of Kuwait, granted to the Kuwait Financial Centre Company for marketing units of the Markaz Arabi Fund Company

Having reviewed:
- Law No. (7) of 2010 regarding the establishment of the Capital Markets Authority and the regulation of securities activities, and its executive regulations and their amendments;
- The Memorandum of Association and Articles of Association of the Kuwait Financial Centre Company;
- The request from the Kuwait Financial Centre Company to undertake the private marketing of units of the Markaz Arabi Fund Company;
- And based on Decision No. (24) of 2023 regarding the amendment of the final approval authorities for the work procedures of the Supervision Sector, issued on 12/02/2023.

The following has been decided:
## Article One
The Kuwait Financial Centre Company <orig>شركة المركز المالي الكويتي</orig> is licensed to privately market 25,000,000 units (only twenty-five million units) of the Markaz Arabi Fund Company <orig>شركة صندوق المركز العربي</orig> within the State of Kuwait <orig>دولة الكويت</orig>. The fund is established in the Kingdom of Bahrain <orig>مملكة البحرين</orig>. The offer price shall be based on the unit price on the subsequent valuation day, in addition to a subscription fee of 0.5% of the subscription amount, provided that the maximum total value of the units offered in the State of Kuwait <orig>دولة الكويت</orig> does not exceed 50 million Kuwaiti Dinars <orig>دينار كويتي</orig> (only fifty million Kuwaiti Dinars <orig>دينار كويتي</orig>).

## Article Two
The units to be marketed within the State of Kuwait <orig>دولة الكويت</orig> shall be offered to professional clients only, as stipulated in Book One (Definitions) of the Executive Regulations of Law No. 7 of 2010 regarding the establishment of the Capital Markets Authority <orig>هيئة أسواق المال</orig> and the regulation of securities activities and their amendments. The entity receiving subscription applications shall be:
- Kuwait Financial Centre Company <orig>شركة المركز المالي الكويتي</orig>.

## Article Three
The objectives of the collective investment scheme shall be determined based on the information provided in the prospectus.

## Article Four
The duration of the marketing license is one year, renewable annually, starting from the date of issuance of the Authority's license certificate and after payment of the prescribed fees.

## Article Five
The prescribed fees shall be paid within one month from the date of issuance of this decision. In the event of failure to pay the fees within the specified period, this decision shall be considered null and void.

## Article Six
The competent authorities shall implement this decision, each within its jurisdiction. It shall come into effect from the date of its issuance and shall be published in the Official Gazette <orig>الجريدة الرسمية</orig>.

Head of the Supervision Sector <orig>رئيس قطاع الإشراف</orig>
Ziad Yaqoub Yousef Al-Fulaij <orig>زياد يعقوب يوسف الفليج</orig>

Issued on: 30 December 2024 AD
<page_end>159</page_end>

# Kuwait Direct Investment Promotion Authority
## Decision No. (568) of 2024

The Director General of the Kuwait Direct Investment Promotion Authority <orig>هيئة تشجيع الاستثمار المباشر</orig>
- Having reviewed Law No. (116) of 2013 regarding the promotion of direct investment in the State of Kuwait,
- And the Decision of the Deputy Prime Minister and Minister of Commerce and Industry No. (502) of 2014 issuing the Executive Regulations of Law No. (116) of 2013 regarding the promotion of direct investment in the State of Kuwait,
- And the Director General's Decision No. (246) of 2017 regarding the system for registering and accrediting companies and consulting offices to submit applications on behalf of investors to the Kuwait Direct Investment Promotion Authority,
- And the Director General's Decision No. (417) of 2017 regarding the registration of accredited companies and offices with the Kuwait Direct Investment Promotion Authority to submit applications on behalf of investors,
- And the Director General's Decision No. (515) of 2023 regarding the renewal of registration for accredited companies and offices with the Kuwait Direct Investment Promotion Authority to submit applications on behalf of investors,
- And upon the recommendations of the One-Stop Shop Department at the Kuwait Direct Investment Promotion Authority in its memorandum No. (276/2024) dated 25/12/2024,
- And for the good of the work,

Has decided

### Article One
The registration of the companies and offices listed below in the register of accredited companies and offices with the Kuwait Direct Investment Promotion Authority to submit applications on behalf of investors is renewed for a period of one year from the date of issuance of the registration certificate:
1. Ernst & Young Consulting Company.
2. Kuwait Financial Centre Company.
3. Aon Gulf General Trading and Contracting Company.
4. BDO for Economic, Administrative, Industrial, and Computer Consulting and Fath Private Training Company.
5. Deloitte Consulting Company.
6. KPMG Consulting Company.
7. Meysan Partners Law Firm and Legal Consultations.
8. Ahmad Abdullatif Al-Rouwayeh & Partners Law Office – ASAR.
9. International Legal Group Office for Legal Studies, Consultations, and Law Practice.

# The Public Authority for Housing Welfare <orig>المؤسسة العامة للرعاية السكنية</orig>
## Ministerial Resolution No. (59) of 2024
### Amending certain provisions of the Housing Welfare Regulation

The Minister of State for Housing Affairs:
- Having reviewed Law No. (47) of 1993 concerning Housing Welfare and its amending laws,
- And Law No. (27) of 1995 concerning the contribution of the private sector in the development of state-owned vacant lands for housing welfare purposes and its amending laws,
- And the Housing Welfare Regulation issued by Ministerial Resolution No. (31) of 2016 and its amendments,
- And based on the approval of the Authority's Board of Directors in its meeting No. (2024-2025/04) held on 26/11/2024.

Has Decided

### Article One
The texts of Articles (46, 49, 51) of the aforementioned Housing Welfare Regulation shall be replaced with the following texts:

### Article (46):
Exchange of housing alternatives is permissible between beneficiaries, or between them and the Authority, for reasons accepted by the Authority, in accordance with the following regulations:
1- The exchange of plots that have been physically handed over may occur before the start of construction or after its completion and connection to the electrical current. Exchange of partially constructed plots is permissible, provided the bank's approval is obtained.
2- The exchange of housing alternatives between beneficiaries shall not be restricted by the priority of the housing application registration.

### Article (49):
The Authority may accept the waiver by beneficiaries of the housing alternatives allocated to them for reasons accepted by the Authority, in accordance with the following regulations:
1. The waiver of plots that have been physically handed over may occur before the start of construction or after its completion and connection to the electrical current. Waiver of partially constructed plots is permissible, provided the bank's approval is obtained.
2 - The priority of the waiving party in obtaining another housing alternative shall be in accordance with the priority of the beneficiary to whom it is waived, if the latter's priority is subsequent to that of the waiving party.

## Article (51)
(The number of exchanges or waivers for housing alternatives that have been actually delivered may not exceed one exchange or one waiver, provided that the waiver is only by a decision of the General Committee. ## Article Two
A new clause No. (5) shall be added to the text of Article (94) of the aforementioned Housing Welfare Regulation, with the following text:

KD (seventy-five Kuwaiti Dinars <orig>خمسة وسبعون ديناراً كويتياً</orig>), provided that the documents are delivered to the authorized representative of the company or establishment purchasing them, by virtue of an official letter.

1- The deadline for submitting bids to the Procurement and Warehouses Department at the Ministry of Public Works <orig>وزارة الأشغال العامة</orig> is 1:00 PM on Monday, 20/01/2025. Any bid submitted after this deadline will be rejected.
2- The bidder must be a Kuwaiti company registered with the Central Agency for Information Technology <orig>الجهاز المركزي لتكنولوجيا المعلومات</orig> and the Central Agency for Public Tenders <orig>جهاز المناقصات العامة</orig>.
3- The bidder must be a company that has executed similar projects in ministries and government entities in Kuwait and has at least ten years of business experience. Supporting documents must be attached.
4- The initial guarantee amount shall be no less than 2% of the total value of the tenderer's bid. This guarantee must be valid for the entire duration of the bid's validity, in the form of a certified check or an unconditional letter of guarantee issued by one of the approved Kuwaiti banks in favor of the Ministry of Public Works <orig>وزارة الأشغال العامة</orig>. The bidder may not claim any interest on the amount of this guarantee.
5- The final guarantee amount is: at least 10% of the total contract value, in the form of an unconditional letter of guarantee, free of any reservations, issued by one of the approved Kuwaiti banks in favor of the Ministry. The creditors of the second party may not seize the guarantee amount, and no interest shall be paid on it.
6- Contract execution period: (3) full calendar years.
7- The bid shall remain valid for a period of 90 days (ninety days) from the date of opening the bid envelopes.
8- The tender is indivisible.
9- Alternative offers will not be accepted.
10- This tender is open to all companies and establishments that hold an agency registration certificate issued by the Ministry of Commerce and Industry <orig>وزارة التجارة والصناعة</orig> or are an authorized distributor for this work, and are registered with the Ministry in the suppliers' register and with the Central Agency for Public Tenders <orig>الجهاز المركزي للمناقصات العامة</orig> for the year 2025.
11- A preliminary meeting will be held for all those interested in participating in this tender to answer their inquiries. The meeting will take place in the meeting room of the Information Systems Center Department at the Ministry of Public Works <orig>وزارة الأشغال العامة</orig> building in South Surra on Monday, 13/01/2025 (at 10:00 AM). Whether the tenderer attends this preliminary meeting or not, they shall be considered fully aware of all decisions, directives, and recommendations made in this meeting, both before and after the contract is signed.
12- A clearance certificate issued by the Ministry of Electricity, Water and Renewable Energy <orig>وزارة الكهرباء والماء والطاقة المتجددة</orig> must be attached to the bid, stating that the bidder is clear of consumption debts...
13- A certificate of payment of contributions to the Public Institution for Social Security <orig>المؤسسة العامة للتأمينات الاجتماعية</orig> as stipulated in Article (95) of the Social Security Law.
14- A valid "To Whom It May Concern" certificate issued by the Public Authority for Manpower <orig>الهيئة العامة للقوى العاملة</orig> must be attached to the bid, stating that there is no hold on the bidder's file regarding government contracts registered with the Authority..
15- A clearance certificate issued by the Kuwait Foundation for the Advancement of Sciences <orig>مؤسسة الكويت للتقدم العلمي</orig> must be attached to the bid, confirming the company's contribution payment.

Undersecretary of the Ministry of Public Works <orig>وكيل وزارة الأشغال العامة</orig>

## Announcement

The owners of the company: Aramed for Trading in Medical Devices <orig>ارامد للاتجار في الأجهزة الطبية</orig> have submitted a request to the Department of Partnerships at the Ministry to carry out:
A change of legal entity from: A One-Person Company to the new legal entity: A Limited Liability Company
Anyone with an objection is requested to file it with the Court of First Instance within thirty days from the date of this announcement's publication, in accordance with the usual procedures for filing a lawsuit. The submission of an objection will result in the continued liability of the joint partners (in the case of a general or simple limited partnership only) towards this creditor until their objection is decided by a final judgment.

## Minutes of the Extraordinary General Assembly Meeting
Held at twelve o'clock noon on Sunday, December 22, 2024

The Extraordinary General Assembly meeting was held at twelve o'clock noon on Sunday, December 22, 2024, at the company's headquarters in the Sharq <orig>الشرق</orig> area – Al-Sour Street, Al-Tijaria Tower, 18th Floor.
After announcing the legal quorum for the meeting was met, with a percentage of 99.6397%, totaling 49,819,862 shares,
the meeting was opened by Mr. Bandar Mohammed Al-Mutairi <orig>بندر محمد المطيري</orig> – Chairman of the Board of Directors <orig>رئيس مجلس الادارة</orig>, who welcomed the attendees. The Assembly then began discussing the items on the agenda as follows:

First: Amendment of Article (27) and Article (36) of the Articles of Association <orig>النظام الأساسي</orig>.

### Text Before Amendment
**Article 27:**
The company shall be managed by a Board of Directors composed of three members, and the term of membership shall be three years, renewable.
If it is not possible to elect a new Board of Directors on the specified date, the existing Board shall continue to manage the company's business until the reasons preventing the election are resolved and a new Board of Directors is elected.

### Text After Amendment
**Article 27:**
The company shall be managed by a Board of Directors composed of five members. The number of independent board members shall not be less than two and shall not exceed half of the board members. The term of membership shall be three years, renewable.
If it is not possible to elect a new Board of Directors on the specified date, the existing Board shall continue to manage the company's business until the reasons preventing the election are resolved and a new Board of Directors is elected.

### Text Before Amendment
**Article 36:**
A candidate for membership of the Board of Directors must meet the following conditions:
1 – To have the legal capacity to act.
2 – Not to have been previously convicted of a felony with a penalty restricting freedom, or a crime of bankruptcy by default or fraud, or a crime against honor or trust, or a penalty restricting freedom for violating the provisions of this law, unless he has been rehabilitated.
3 – To be a personal owner, or the person he represents to be an owner, of a number of the company's shares. If a board member loses any of the preceding conditions, his membership shall be terminated.

### Text After Amendment
**Article 36:**
A candidate for membership of the Board of Directors must meet the following conditions:
1 – To have the legal capacity to act.
2 – Not to have been previously convicted of a felony with a penalty restricting freedom, or a crime of bankruptcy by default or fraud, or a crime against honor or trust, or a penalty restricting freedom for violating the provisions of this law, unless he has been rehabilitated.
3 – With the exception of independent board members, he must be a personal owner, or the person he represents must be an owner, of a number of the company's shares. If a board member loses any of the preceding conditions, his membership shall be terminated.

Second: Addition of Article 77
The relevant regulatory authorities shall establish corporate governance rules for the companies under their supervision, in a manner that achieves the best protection and balance between the interests of the company's management, its shareholders, and other related stakeholders. They shall also specify the conditions that must be met by independent board members.
Regulatory authorities may require companies under their supervision to have one or more independent members with experience and competence on their Board of Directors, to be elected by the Ordinary General Assembly, which shall also determine their remuneration in accordance with governance rules, provided that their number does not exceed half of the board members. It is not required for an independent member to be a shareholder in the company.
The meeting concluded at one o'clock in the afternoon.

Chairman of the Board of Directors

# International Leasing and Investment Company <orig>شركة الدولية للإجارة والاستثمار</orig>
## Minutes of the (Adjourned) Extraordinary General Assembly Meeting

On Sunday, 22/12/2024, at 2:00 PM, the (adjourned) Extraordinary General Assembly meeting of the International Leasing and Investment Company <orig>شركة الدولية للإجارة والاستثمار</orig> was held, chaired by the Vice Chairman of the Board of Directors and Chief Executive Officer, Mr. Meshal Abdulaziz Al-Nemsh <orig>مشعل عبدالعزيز النمش</orig>, and in the presence of Ms. Al-Khansaa Habib Nasser <orig>الخنساء حبيب ناصر</orig> (Secretary), at the company's headquarters (Al-Qibla <orig>القبلة</orig> – Fahad Al-Salem Street <orig>شارع فهد السالم</orig> – Al-Nassar Tower <orig>برج النصار</orig> – 25th Floor).

At the beginning of the meeting, Mr. Meshal Abdulaziz Al-Nemsh <orig>مشعل عبد العزيز النمش</orig> welcomed the attendees and announced the shareholder attendance rate, which reached 69.721% of the company's shareholders. He then proceeded to the agenda, which was as follows:

First: Approval of the proposed amendments to the Company's Memorandum of Association and Articles of Association concerning (commercial activity, trade name, purposes, and capital currency).

### Amendment of Article (2) of the Memorandum of Association and Article (1) of the Articles of Association:

**Before Amendment:**
- The name of this company is: International Leasing and Investment Company (a Kuwaiti Closed Joint-Stock Company).
- It was established in accordance with the provisions of Law No. (12) of (1998) authorizing the establishment of leasing companies and its Executive Regulations issued by Council of Ministers Resolution No. 98/543, and in accordance with the provisions of the Commercial Companies Law and these Articles of Association, among the shareholders whose provisions are set out hereinafter, a Kuwaiti joint-stock company named / International Leasing and Investment Company ("a Kuwaiti Closed Joint-Stock Company" <orig>شركة مساهمة كويتية مقفلة</orig>).

**After Amendment:**
- The name of this company is: Landmark Tower Real Estate Company (a Kuwaiti Closed Joint-Stock Company).
- It was established in accordance with the provisions of the Commercial Companies Law, in compliance with the articles stipulated in Companies Law No. 1 of 2016, its Executive Regulations, and its amendments. ## Amendment of Article No. (7) of the Memorandum of Association and Article No. (6) of the Articles of Association:
### Before Amendment:
The purposes for which the company was established must be practiced in accordance with the principles of the tolerant Islamic Sharia <orig>الشريعة الإسلامية السمحة</orig>, and the company may not, directly or indirectly, engage in any transaction that involves dealing with usury (Riba <orig>الربا</orig>) or interest, whether taking or giving, or that contradicts the provisions of Islamic Sharia <orig>الشريعة الإسلامية</orig>.

### After Amendment:
Deletion of Article No. (7) of the Memorandum of Association.
Deletion of Article No. (6) of the Articles of Association.

## Amendment of Article No. (8) of the Memorandum of Association and Article No. (7) of the Articles of Association:
### Before Amendment:
The authorized and subscribed capital of the company was set at an amount of 104,350,400 US Dollars (one hundred four million, three hundred fifty thousand, and four hundred US Dollars), divided into 313,051,200 shares (three hundred thirteen million, fifty-one thousand, and two hundred shares), with a value of (1/3) US Dollar (one-third of a US Dollar) per share.

### After Amendment:
The authorized, issued, and paid-up capital of the company is set at an amount of 31,305,120 Kuwaiti Dinars <orig>دينار كويتي</orig> (thirty-one million, three hundred five thousand, one hundred and twenty Kuwaiti Dinars), divided into 313,051,200 shares (three hundred thirteen million, fifty-one thousand, and two hundred shares), with a value of 100 Kuwaiti Fils <orig>فلس كويتي</orig> (one hundred Kuwaiti Fils) per share, and all shares are in cash.

## Amendment of Article No. (14) of the Articles of Association:
### Before Amendment:
The capital may not be increased unless the installments for the shares have been fully paid. New shares may not be issued for less than their nominal value. If they are issued for more, the difference must be added to the statutory reserve after covering the issuance expenses. Each shareholder has priority in subscribing to a portion of the new shares proportional to the number of their shares, and a period of fifteen days from the date of publishing the invitation to shareholders shall be granted to exercise this priority right.

### After Amendment:
The authorized capital may not be increased unless the value of the original shares has been fully paid. The Extraordinary General Assembly may authorize the Board of Directors to determine the mechanism and date of its implementation, provided that the capital increase is carried out in accordance with the articles stipulated in the Companies Law No. 1 of 2016, its executive regulations, and its amendments regarding capital increase.

## Amendment of Article No. (15) of the Articles of Association:
### Before Amendment:
For the purpose of attracting competent employees to work for the company, the Board of Directors has the right to create a system called the (Competent Employee Stock Option Plan), the purpose of which is to provide an incentive to attract competent employees to work for the company and enhance their loyalty to it, provided that the following is observed:
1- The company's capital may be increased to meet the company's obligations under the (Competent Employee Stock Option Plan), provided that the total ownership of the employees benefiting from this system does not exceed a percentage of (10%) of the company's capital.
2- Members of the Board of Directors may not participate in the Competent Employee Stock Option Plan, with the exception of the company's Managing Director <orig>العضو المنتدب</orig>.
3- This system shall be presented to the company's General Assembly for final approval.

### After Amendment:
Deletion of Article No. (15) of the Articles of Association.

## Amendment of Article No. (43) of the Articles of Association:
### Before Amendment:
The following matters shall only be considered by the General Assembly convened in an extraordinary session:
1- Amending the company's Memorandum of Association or Articles of Association.
2- Selling the entire project undertaken by the company or disposing of it in any other manner.
3- Dissolving the company or merging it with another company or entity.
Any amendment to the company's articles shall not be effective until after the approval of the Ministry of Commerce <orig>وزارة التجارة</orig>

(Closed) <orig>شركة جولف سات للاتصالات ش.م.ك (مقفلة)</orig> was held on Monday, November 25, 2024, at 11:00 AM at the company's headquarters located in Salmiya <orig>السالمية</orig> – Salem Al-Mubarak Street <orig>شارع سالم المبارك</orig> – Dalal Complex <orig>مجمع دلال</orig> – Sixth Floor.

(Text after Amendment)
"Subject to the provisions contained in the company's articles of incorporation, the Ordinary General Assembly may, upon the proposal of the Board of Directors, distribute profits to shareholders at the end of the financial year or at the end of each financial period. The validity of this distribution is conditional upon it being from actual profits, in accordance with generally accepted accounting principles, and that this distribution does not affect the company's paid-up capital."

### Held on Monday, 02/12/2024

The Extraordinary General Assembly of Mena Homes Real Estate Company (K.S.C.C.) <orig>شركة مينا هومز العقارية (ش.م.ك.) مقفلة</orig> (Closed) held its extraordinary meeting at 12:00 PM on Monday, 02/12/2024, at the headquarters of the parent company (United Real Estate Company <orig>شركة العقارات المتحدة</orig> "K.S.C.P.") in Sharq <orig>الشرق</orig> – Khalid Bin Al-Waleed Street <orig>شارع خالد بن الوليد</orig> – KIPCO Tower <orig>برج كيبكو</orig> – 24th Floor.
The meeting was chaired by Mr. Mazen Essam Hawwa <orig>مازن عصام حوا</orig> – Chairman of the Board of Directors. The following also attended the meeting:
- Mr. Hamoud Al-Shammari <orig>حمود الشمري</orig> from the company's auditor's office (Ernst & Young) – Al-Aiban, Al-Osaimi & Partners <orig>مكتب العيبان والعصيمي وشركاهم</orig>.
- Mr. Abda Salama Hassan Al-Dabaa <orig>عبدة سلامة حسن الضبع</orig> (Secretary of the Assembly).
- Mr. Tareq Anabousi <orig>طارق عنبوسي</orig> – attending on behalf of shareholder number (00000809378) and owning 49,997 shares (United Tamleek Real Estate Services LLC <orig>شركة تمليك المتحدة للخدمات العقارية ذ.م.م</orig>) (representing the minority stake).
Shareholders owning (100%) of the company's shares by proxy attended the meeting. After the announcement of the legal quorum for the validity of the Extraordinary General Assembly meeting, Mr. Mazen Essam Hawwa <orig>مازن عصام حوا</orig>, "Chairman of the Assembly," opened the meeting session, welcoming the attendees. Subsequently, the agenda items were reviewed and discussed, and the following was approved and ratified:
Firstly: Approval of the amendment to Article No. (47) of the Articles of Association of Mena Homes Real Estate Company (K.S.C.C. <orig>ش.م.ك. مقفلة</orig> Closed) as follows:
Text before amendment:–
Net profits shall be distributed as follows:–
Firstly: (10%) shall be deducted and allocated to the statutory reserve account, unless the Articles of Association specify a higher percentage. The General Assembly may cease the deduction if the statutory reserve exceeds half of the company's capital.
Secondly: Another (1%) shall be deducted and allocated to the Kuwait Foundation for the Advancement of Sciences <orig>مؤسسة الكويت للتقدم العلمي</orig> account.
Thirdly: A percentage shall be deducted and allocated to the optional reserve account, as proposed by the Board of Directors and approved by the General Assembly. This deduction shall cease by a resolution of the Ordinary General Assembly based on a proposal from the Board of Directors.
Fourthly: A portion of the profits shall be deducted, based on the proposal of the Board of Directors and decided by the General Assembly, to meet the company's obligations under labor laws. These funds may not be distributed to shareholders.
Fifthly: The amount necessary to distribute a first share of profits, amounting to (5%) five percent, to shareholders shall be deducted, as determined by the Board of Directors and decided by the General Assembly.
Sixthly: After the foregoing, an amount decided by the Ordinary General Assembly, not exceeding (10%) ten percent of the remainder, shall be deducted and allocated for Board of Directors' remuneration.
Seventhly: The remaining profits shall then be distributed to shareholders as an additional share in profits, or carried forward to the next year based on a proposal from the Board of Directors, or allocated to establish a general reserve fund or an extraordinary depreciation fund.

Second: Another (1%) shall be deducted and allocated to the account of the Kuwait Foundation for the Advancement of Sciences <orig>مؤسسة الكويت للتقدم العلمي</orig>.
Third: A percentage shall be deducted and allocated to the voluntary reserve account, as proposed by the Board of Directors and approved by the General Assembly. This deduction shall be suspended by a resolution of the Ordinary General Assembly based on a proposal from the Board of Directors.
Fourth: A portion of the profits shall be deducted, based on a proposal by the Board of Directors and a resolution by the General Assembly, to meet the company's obligations under labor laws. These funds may not be distributed to shareholders.
Fifth: The amount necessary to distribute a first dividend of (5%) five percent to the shareholders shall be deducted, as determined by the Board of Directors and resolved by the General Assembly.
Sixth: After the foregoing, an amount resolved by the Ordinary General Assembly, not exceeding (10%) ten percent of the remainder, shall be deducted and allocated for the remuneration of the Board of Directors.
Seventh: The remainder of the profits shall then be distributed to the shareholders as an additional dividend, or carried forward to the next year upon the proposal of the Board of Directors, or allocated to establish a general reserve fund or an extraordinary depreciation fund.
Eighth: The Ordinary General Assembly may, upon the proposal of the Board of Directors, distribute cash or in-kind dividends to the shareholders at the end of the fiscal year or at the end of each financial period, i.e., annually, semi-annually, or quarterly. It may also, by a resolution of the Ordinary General Assembly, pre-authorize the Board of Directors to distribute interim cash dividends on a semi-annual or quarterly basis, provided that such distribution is from actual profits, in accordance with generally accepted accounting principles, and does not affect the company's paid-up capital.
The Extraordinary General Assembly authorizes the Board of Directors to distribute interim dividends throughout the current year and until the convening of the Ordinary General Assembly to discuss the financial statements for the fiscal year ending on 12/31/2024, in accordance with the above conditions. The authorization for subsequent years shall be granted by the Ordinary General Assembly.
At the end of the meeting, Mr. Mazen Essam Hawa <orig>مازن عصام حوا</orig>, the "Chairman of the Assembly," thanked the attendees, and the proceedings of the Extraordinary General Assembly meeting were concluded at twelve-thirty in the afternoon on the same day.

## Issuance of Practice No. MM 48-2024/2025 for the Supply, Installation, and Warranty of Sports Equipment
## For the needs of the General Technical Directorate for Girls' Physical Education <orig>التوجيه الفني العام للتربية البدنية بنات</orig>
The Ministry of Education <orig>وزارة التربية</orig> announces the issuance of a public practice under No. MM 48 for the year 2024/2025 for the supply, installation, and warranty of sports equipment for the needs of the General Technical Directorate for Girls' Physical Education <orig>التوجيه الفني العام للتربية البدنية بنات</orig>, and the execution of all works subject of the practice in accordance with the general and special conditions, technical specifications, and tables of items, numbers, quantities, and prices within the period specified in the practice documents, and generally in accordance with all provisions contained in the practice documents and the contract to be concluded based thereon.

### General Instructions for Bidders:
1. The practice is (public) for bidders accredited by the Ministry of Education <orig>وزارة التربية</orig> to perform the work subject of the practice.
2. Applicants for this practice must be specialized companies/institutions (within Kuwait) in carrying out all the work subject of the practice, registered in the Commercial Registry and the Kuwait Chamber of Commerce and Industry <orig>غرفة تجارة وصناعة الكويت</orig> for the current year. The applying companies must have prior experience in this field and possess the capabilities and specialized, trained technical labor to execute the work subject of the practice.
3. This practice is divisible, and pertains to the execution of all work subject of the practice in accordance with the general and special conditions, technical specifications, and tables of items, numbers, quantities, and prices. The bidder is not entitled to submit alternative bids (tenders), as the practice documents do not permit the submission of alternative bids (tenders), and must adhere to what is stated in the documents of this practice in this regard.
4. The bidder must submit with their bid an initial deposit <orig>تأميناً أولياً</orig> of 2% of the bid value in the form of a certified check or an unconditional and irrevocable letter of guarantee, free of any reservations, issued by one of the approved banks in the State of Kuwait in their name and for the benefit of the Ministry of Education <orig>وزارة التربية</orig>. This deposit must be valid for the duration of the bid's validity. Any bid not accompanied by this full deposit will be excluded. Initial deposits may not be returned until after (90) days from the closing date of the practice or when the winning bidder submits the final deposit and signs the contract, unless the practice is canceled. The Ministry of Education <orig>وزارة التربية</orig> will not pay any interest on the amount of this deposit, and the bidder's creditors may not seize its amount.
5. The total duration of the contract is (12 months), during which the contractor is obligated to execute all work subject of the practice in accordance with the general and special conditions, technical specifications, and tables of items, numbers, quantities, and prices, according to the general and special conditions, provisions, and technical specifications contained in the practice documents.
6. The bid shall remain in effect and irrevocable from the time of its submission for a period of (90 days) from the date of opening the bid envelopes. No price adjustments will be accepted after the bid is submitted. If it is not possible to decide on the bids within the specified validity period, bidders will be asked to accept the extension of their bids' validity for another similar period at most. Each must agree in writing to the extension and specify the duration of the initial deposit. The bid of anyone who does not accept the extension of its validity period will be excluded.
7. If, upon studying the practice, the bidder finds any error, omission, or discrepancy in the technical documents or in the schedule of quantities that may affect the categories of their bid or the value of the works, they must seek clarification from the Ministry of Education <orig>وزارة التربية</orig> before submitting their bid. The Ministry will study these observations and inquiries if they are serious, answer them, and remove any error, omission, discrepancy, or conflict (if any), or circulate the clarification and response by means of a letter addressed to every bidder who purchased the practice documents. The response in this case shall be considered an integral part of those practice documents. In all cases, this shall not result in any additional responsibility or obligation on the part of the Ministry.
8. Bids shall be deposited in the designated box at the headquarters of the Supplies and Warehousing Department <orig>إدارة التوريدات والمخازن</orig> (in the South Subhan <orig>صبحان الجنوبي</orig> area) during official working hours, no later than 15 working days. No bid received after the aforementioned deadline will be considered, nor will any change, modification, or reduction in

## Announcement
The Ministry of Interior <orig>وزارة الداخلية</orig> announces Tender No. (L.A. 63/2024-2025) for the repair, maintenance, and operation of air conditioning units (split - window) at the facilities of the General Directorate of Land Border Security <orig>الإدارة العامة لأمن الحدود البرية</orig> (Northern and Southern Regions) for the General Directorate of Construction and Maintenance <orig>الإدارة العامة للإنشاءات والصيانة</orig> at the Ministry of Interior <orig>وزارة الداخلية</orig>.
Companies/institutions specialized in air conditioning works with a minimum of (10 years) of prior experience in this field should visit the General Directorate of Financial Affairs <orig>الإدارة العامة للشئون المالية</orig> – Tenders Department <orig>إدارة المناقصات</orig> (Ardiya Industrial Area <orig>منطقة العارضية الصناعية</orig>) – to obtain the documents for this tender for a fee of (150/- K.D.) only one hundred and fifty Kuwaiti Dinars <orig>ديناراً كويتيا</orig>, non-refundable, payable via "K-Net". Note that the final insurance for the tender is 10% of the total contract value. - A valid registration receipt from the Ministry of Interior <orig>وزارة الداخلية</orig>. Or

# Ministry of Health <orig>وزارة الصحة</orig>
## Announcement
The Ministry of Health <orig>وزارة الصحة</orig> (Medical Warehouses Department – Medical Supplies Control) announces the following tenders:

<table_caption>Tender Details for Medical Supplies</table_caption>
<table>
| No. | Tender No. | Description | Fees | Closing Date |
|:---:|:---|:---|:---:|:---|
| 1 | 4PD118 | Stents for the heart for patients in the Internal Special Requests Department | 75 | 10 days or more from the date of announcement |
</table>

Bids are to be placed in the tender box at the Medical Warehouses Department. Bids must be valid for a period of (90 days) from the closing date. Companies wishing to participate in the tender must meet the following conditions:
1- The local company must be registered in the Suppliers Register at the Medical Warehouses Department.
2- The local company must be specialized in the medical field, documented by a certified certificate from the Chamber of Commerce and Industry.
3- When submitting two offers, two separate tender booklets must be purchased with two different receipts.
4- Attach a valid product registration certificate from the Department of Registration and Control of Medical and Herbal Drugs, or proof of submission of the certificate, and a copy of the manufacturer's and the product's registration in the Suppliers Register at the Medical Warehouses Department, within the contents of the submitted bid (specific to the Drug Control Department).
5- Provide samples of new materials, whether it is a new product being requested for the first time or from a new manufacturer, to the relevant control department (Drugs – Medical Supplies).

- Property under Document No. 2022/1169, located in the Al-Andalus <orig>الأندلس</orig> area – Plot No. 5 <orig>قطعة رقم 5</orig> – Parcel 121 <orig>قسيمة 121</orig> – Plan M/33782 – with an area of 500 m², to be sold by public auction with a base price of KWD 450,000 (Four hundred fifty thousand Kuwaiti Dinars <orig>دينار كويتي</orig>).

There are violations: 1- Creation of an external door for the Diwaniya.

The expert visited the property subject of the lawsuit on 11/6/2023, located in the Al-Andalus <orig>الأندلس</orig> area – Plot 5 – Street 6 – Parcel No. 121 – Automated No. (12771822), guided by and in the presence of the third plaintiff and the first defendant's agent, and in the presence of the technical expert, Mr. Khaled Al-Khodair <orig>خالد الخضير</orig>.

The inspection was carried out as follows:
- The property subject of the lawsuit is an old private residence located on a single street, bordered by two neighbors, with an exterior cladding of Jordanian stone.
- The area of the property subject of the lawsuit is 500 m² according to Title Deed No. 2022/1179.
- The property has 3 external entrances (a side entrance, a main entrance, and an entrance to the Diwaniya).
- The third plaintiff enabled the expert to inspect the property from the inside.
- The property subject of the lawsuit consists of a ground floor, a first floor, and a roof. The details of the floors are as follows:
A- Ground Floor: An external Diwaniya with a bathroom and a preparatory kitchen + two (2) halls + a maid's room with a bathroom + a bathroom and washbasins + two (2) master bedrooms with a bathroom and a dressing room + one (1) master bedroom with a bathroom + a main kitchen + a preparatory kitchen leading to a courtyard, the side entrance of the property, and the entrance to the first floor.
B- First Floor: Two identical apartments in terms of components, where each apartment consists of a kitchen + one (1) master bedroom with a bathroom + a room + a bathroom + a hall.
C- Roof: There is a large room with a bathroom for the maid + air conditioning units.

The property's finishes are as follows:
- Doors: wood + aluminum – Walls: regular paint + wallpaper – Air conditioning: split units + central.
- Lighting: spotlights + pendant lights – Floors: ceramic – Windows: aluminum with security bars.

- The third plaintiff (Qout <orig>قوت</orig>) stated that she, the second plaintiff (Wadha <orig>وضحة</orig>), and their children reside in the property subject of the lawsuit with the consent of the heirs, as they are divorcees and their mother, and they have not prevented any of the heirs from entering or benefiting from the property.
- The third plaintiff stated that the first defendant (Fatima <orig>فاطمة</orig>) used to live with them until she filed a lawsuit against them two years ago. She guided the expert to the master bedroom on the ground floor to the right of the main entrance of the property and stated that it was the first defendant's room. The expert found the room to be empty of furniture.
- The technical expert took all his notes on the disputed property and reviewed the previous expert report for the same lawsuit in order to estimate the value of the property and provide his valuation.

## Second: Auction Conditions:

First: The auction shall begin at the base price. Participation in the auction requires payment of at least one-fifth of that price by a certified check from the drawee bank or by a letter of guarantee from a bank in favor of the Enforcement Directorate at the Ministry of Justice <orig>وزارة العدل</orig>.
Second: The person whose bid is approved by the judge must deposit, during the sale session, the full approved price, expenses, and registration fees.
Third: If the person whose bid was approved does not deposit the full price, he must deposit at least one-fifth of the price; otherwise, the bidding will be reopened at his expense in the same session, based on the price at which the sale was awarded.
Fourth: If the bidder deposits the price in the following session, the auction will be awarded to him, unless someone comes forward in this session who agrees to purchase with a ten percent increase, accompanied by a deposit of the full auction price. In this case, the bidding will be reopened in the same session on the basis of this new price.

# Announcement of a Property Sale by Public Auction

The Clerks' Department of the Court of First Instance <orig>إدارة الكتاب بالمحكمة الكلية</orig> announces the sale by public auction of the property described below on Wednesday, 29/1/2025, in Hall 48 on the second floor of the Justice Palace <orig>قصر العدل</orig> at 9:00 AM. This is in execution of the court judgment issued in Case No. 158/2023 Sales/2.

**Filed by:**
Hurriya Owaid Khalif Al-Anzi <orig>حرية عويد خليف العنزي</orig>

**Against:**
1- Badr Awadh Khalif Al-Anzi <orig>بدر عوض خليف العنزي</orig>.

**Property Description: As stated in the Municipality's description certificate.**

## Second: Auction Conditions:
First: The auction shall begin at the base price indicated for the property. Participation in the auction requires payment of at least one-fifth of that price by a certified check from the drawee bank or by a letter of guarantee from a bank in favor of the Execution Department at the Ministry of Justice <orig>إدارة التنفيذ بوزارة العدل</orig>.
Second: The person whose bid is approved by the judge must deposit, during the sale session, the full approved price, expenses, and registration fees.
Third: If the person whose bid was approved does not deposit the full price, he must deposit at least one-fifth of the price; otherwise, the auction shall be repeated at his own risk during the same session, based on the price at which the sale was awarded.
Fourth: If the bidder deposits the price in the following session, a judgment shall be issued awarding him the auction, unless another person comes forward in this session who agrees to purchase with an increase of one-tenth, accompanied by a deposit of the full auction price. In this case, the auction shall be repeated in the same session on the basis of this new price.
Fifth: If the first bidder does not deposit the full price in the following session and no one comes forward with the one-tenth increase, the auction shall be immediately repeated at his own risk on the basis of the price that was awarded to him in the previous session. In this session, no bid shall be considered unless it is accompanied by a deposit of its full value. The defaulting bidder shall be liable for any shortfall in the property's price.

## Notice:
1- This sale announcement shall be published in the Official Gazette in accordance with Article 266 of the Code of Civil and Commercial Procedure <orig>قانون المرافعات</orig>.
2- The judgment awarding the auction is subject to appeal within seven days from the date of its pronouncement, in accordance with Article 277 of the Code of Civil and Commercial Procedure <orig>قانون المرافعات</orig>.
3- The last paragraph of Article 276 of the Code of Civil and Commercial Procedure <orig>قانون المرافعات</orig> stipulates that "If the person whose property has been expropriated is residing in the property, he shall remain therein as a tenant by force of law, and the successful bidder is obligated to issue a lease contract in his favor for a similar rent."

## Important Note:
All companies and sole proprietorships are prohibited from participating in the auction for plots or houses designated for private housing purposes, in accordance with the provisions of Article 230 of the Commercial Companies Law <orig>قانون الشركات التجارية</orig>, as added by Law No. 9 of 2008.

- The disputed property is a plot of 1080 square meters, overlooking two streets (front and back): a street near the roundabout and, from the rear, an internal street overlooking an unpaved square, with entrances from both of the aforementioned sides.

- The disputed property is clad on the exterior with a somewhat old, reddish-yellow stone. There is a garden in the house's courtyard and a separate building for the defendant, Amal Abd Al-Ghaffar Haidar <orig>آمال عبد الغفار حيدر</orig>, which consists of a room with window unit air conditioning, a living room, and a bathroom.
- The expert found a diwaniya, a separate diwaniya building, in the house's courtyard. The defendants' attending agent stated that it is used independently by the plaintiffs for smoking. It measures 7 x 5 m and has window unit air conditioning and new finishes.
- The expert moved to the house, where it was found to have two entrances: a side entrance from the kitchen side. It was found that the ground floor consists of a first living room, a second living room, an internal kitchen, and a bathroom. The attending agent stated that these are also used independently by all parties to the lawsuit, including the plaintiffs.
- The expert found a room and a bathroom for the defendant, Nidhal Abd Al-Ghaffar Haidar <orig>نضال عبد الغفار حيدر</orig>. It was also found that there is a single staircase in the middle of the living room, an elevator, central air conditioning, and beige marble floors.
- The expert proceeded to the first floor and found a furnished and equipped room that was vacant. The agent stated that it was used by the plaintiffs whenever any of them wished to be present.
- The expert found a living room and two rooms on the first floor. The attending agent stated that they are sometimes used by the plaintiffs. There are also two rooms with a bathroom between them, which the agent stated are used independently by the defendant, Tariq Abd Al-Ghaffar Haidar <orig>طارق عبد الغفار حيدر</orig>.
- At 11:18 AM, the third defendant, Manal Abd Al-Ghaffar Ma'rafi <orig>منال عبد الغفار معرفي</orig>, arrived and requested to have her presence recorded and to confirm the attending agent's statement regarding the occupants of the property.
- The expert proceeded to the roof of the property and found two central air conditioning units and a straw-colored red tile roof. The expert found that the courtyard of the disputed property has tile flooring, and there are plants, palm trees, and unused setbacks.
- The appointed expert took his notes in preparation for drafting the report on the property's value and the monthly rent value of the disputed property.
- The expert asked the third defendant, Manal Abd Al-Ghaffar Ma'rafi <orig>منال عبد الغفار معرفي</orig>, about the number of current occupants of the disputed property. She stated that they are (Nidhal, Amal, and Tariq) Abd Al-Ghaffar Ma'rafi <orig>نضال وآمال وطارق عبد الغفار معرفي</orig>, in addition to the plaintiffs entering and using the disputed property whenever they wish, and that they have two of the external keys. She stated that they enter the property's living room and are not prohibited from entering the property.

## Second: Auction Conditions:
1.  First: The auction shall begin at the base price listed for the property. Participation in the auction requires payment of at least one-fifth of that price by a certified check from the drawee bank or by a letter of guarantee from a bank in favor of the Enforcement Directorate at the Ministry of Justice <orig>إدارة التنفيذ بوزارة العدل</orig>.
2.  Second: The person whose bid is approved by the judge must deposit, during the sale session, the full approved price, plus expenses and registration fees.
3.  Third: If the person whose bid was approved does not deposit the full price, they must deposit at least one-fifth of the price; otherwise, the bidding will be reopened at their liability during the same session, based on the price at which the sale had been awarded.
4.  Fourth: If the bidder deposits the price in the following session, the auction shall be awarded to them, unless someone comes forward in that session who is willing to purchase with a ten percent increase, accompanied by a deposit of the full auction price. In this case, the bidding shall be reopened in the same session on the basis of this new price.
5.  Fifth: If the first bidder fails to deposit the full price in the following session and no one comes forward with the ten percent increase, the bidding shall be immediately reopened at their liability on the basis of the price that was awarded to them in the previous session. No bid in this session shall be considered unless it is accompanied by a deposit of its full value. The defaulting bidder shall be liable for any shortfall in the property's price.
6.  Sixth: The successful bidder shall, in all cases, bear the fees for title transfer and registration, the enforcement procedure expenses amounting to 200 K.D. <orig>د.ك</orig>, legal and expert fees, and the costs of advertising and publishing the sale in daily newspapers.
7.  Seventh: This announcement is published in application of the law and at the request and responsibility of those initiating the sale procedures, without any liability on the part of the Clerks' Department of the Court of First Instance <orig>إدارة الكتاب بالمحكمة الكلية</orig>.
8.  Eighth: The successful bidder acknowledges that they have inspected the property in a manner that negates any lack of knowledge.

### Notice:
1.  This sale announcement is published in the Official Gazette in accordance with Article 266 of the Code of Civil and Commercial Procedure <orig>قانون المرافعات</orig>.
2.  The judgment awarding the auction is subject to appeal within seven days from the date of its pronouncement, in accordance with Article 277 of the Code of Civil and Commercial Procedure <orig>قانون المرافعات</orig>.
3.  The last paragraph of Article 276 of the Code of Civil and Commercial Procedure <orig>قانون المرافعات</orig> states: "If the person whose property was expropriated is residing in the property, they shall remain therein as a tenant by force of law, and the successful bidder shall be obligated to execute a lease agreement in their favor for a comparable rent."

President of the Court of First Instance

Fifth: If the first bidder fails to deposit the full price in the following session and no one comes forward with a ten percent increase, the auction shall be immediately repeated at their liability, based on the price at which it was previously awarded to them. In this session, no bid shall be considered unless it is accompanied by a deposit of its full value. The defaulting bidder shall be liable for any shortfall in the property's price.
Sixth: The successful bidder shall, in all cases, bear the fees for the transfer and registration of ownership, the enforcement procedure expenses amounting to 200 K.D., legal and expert fees, and the costs of advertising and publishing the sale in daily newspapers.
Seventh: This announcement is published in application of the law. Those initiating the sale procedures do so at their own responsibility, without the General Department of the Court Clerks <orig>إدارة الكتاب بالمحكمة الكلية</orig> bearing any liability.
Eighth: The successful bidder acknowledges that they have inspected the property in a manner that negates any lack of knowledge.

## Second: Auction Conditions:
First: The auction shall begin at the starting price set for the property. Participation in the auction requires payment of at least one-fifth of that price by a certified check from the drawee bank or by a letter of guarantee from a bank in favor of the Enforcement Directorate at the Ministry of Justice <orig>وزارة العدل</orig>.

The Ministry of Electricity, Water & Renewable Energy <orig>وزارة الكهرباء والماء والطاقة المتجددة</orig> announces the extension of the closing date for the trial agreement contract for an antiscalant material in distillers with a Multi-Stage Flash (MSF) system at power generation and water distillation plants for high-temperature concentrated brine (105 degrees Celsius), with and without the ball cleaning system in service. Documents can be obtained from the main building of the Ministry of Electricity and Water (South Surra <orig>جنوب السرة</orig>), Sixth Ring Road – First Floor.

- **Request Details:**
- Issue Date: 2024/12/08
- Closing Date: 2025/01/14
- Document Price: (15/– K.D.) (Only fifteen Kuwaiti Dinars <orig>دينار كويتي</orig>).
- Preliminary Meeting: A preliminary meeting will be held for those interested in conducting the trials on Sunday, 2024/12/22 at (10) AM, at the Ministry of Electricity, Water & Renewable Energy <orig>وزارة الكهرباء والماء والطاقة المتجددة</orig>, Elevator No. (2), Third Floor, in the meeting hall of the Power Stations and Water Distillation Projects.
- Trial Implementation Period: (7 months) in one of the distillers at the power and water distillation plants.
- Final Submission Deadline for Proposals: One month from the date of the above announcement for submitting applications, at exactly (12 PM). No application will be accepted thereafter.
- The aforementioned fee is to be paid via K-Net card.
- Companies wishing to submit inquiries, clarifications, etc., must adhere to presenting them to the Ministry at the time and place specified above for the preliminary meeting.
- Owners of small and medium enterprises wishing to apply to conduct a trial must attach to their application a valid certificate issued by the National Fund for Small and Medium Enterprise Development <orig>الصندوق الوطني لرعاية وتنمية المشروعات الصغيرة</orig>.

## Public Authority for Industry <orig>الهيئة العامة للصناعة</orig>

### Announcement
The Public Authority for Industry <orig>الهيئة العامة للصناعة</orig> announces the re-issuance of Practice No. 25-2024 concerning the project on the state of the industrial sector in the State of Kuwait, seeking a consulting firm for the analysis of industrial survey data.
These documents can be obtained by visiting the website bids.pai.gov.kw starting from the date of this announcement's publication.

<table_caption>Tender Details for Practice No. 25-2024</table_caption>
<table>
| Issuance | Closing Date | Document Price | Initial Deposit | Preliminary Meeting |
|---|---|---|---|---|
| 2025/1/5 | 2025/1/13 | 75 K.D. <orig>75 د.ك</orig> | 750 K.D. <orig>750 د.ك</orig> | None. |
</table>

The deadline for submitting bids is Monday, January 13, 2025, at 12:00 PM. Bids must be delivered to the main headquarters of the Public Authority for Industry <orig>الهيئة العامة للصناعة</orig> (Second Floor – Procurement and Warehousing Department – Purchasing Section) in an envelope marked with the practice name. Bids shall be valid for a period of (90) days from the date of unsealing the bid envelopes.
The practitioner must submit a recent "To Whom It May Concern" certificate issued by the Public Authority for Manpower <orig>الهيئة العامة للقوى العاملة</orig> stating that there are no holds on the company's file regarding government contracts registered with the Public Authority for Manpower, and a "To Whom It May Concern" certificate indicating compliance with the national labor percentage, dated currently with the bid date. The practitioner must also deposit with their bid an initial deposit in the form of a certified check or an unconditional, irrevocable, and reservation-free letter of guarantee issued in the bidder's name from one of the approved banks in the State of Kuwait, in favor of the Public Authority for Industry, and valid for the duration of the bid's validity. Any bid not accompanied by this full deposit will be excluded. The initial deposit may not be returned until after (90) days from the practice's closing date or when the winning practitioner signs the contract, unless the practice is canceled. The Authority will not pay any interest on the amount of this deposit, and the practitioner's creditors may not seize this amount. Note that this practice is non-divisible.

## Announcement
### Re-issuance of Practice No. P.A. (10-2024/2025) concerning the Inspection Devices Management Program for the Public Authority for Manpower

The Public Authority for Manpower <orig>الهيئة العامة للقوى العاملة</orig> announces the conduct of a practice for the execution of the aforementioned works and invites all who meet the conditions mentioned in the Public Tenders Law No. (49) of 2016 and its executive regulations, and the Ministry of Finance <orig>وزارة المالية</orig> Circular No. (5) of 2020 regarding procurement systems in public entities, provided that the practitioner is a company or institution classified by the Central Agency for Information Technology <orig>الجهاز المركزي لتكنولوجيا المعلومات</orig> in the same field.
The practice documents can be obtained from the General Services Department – Tenders Preparation and Follow-up Section, 10th floor, at the headquarters of the Public Authority for Manpower in Al-Riggai <orig>الرقعي</orig>, Block 2, Street 106.

- The aforementioned fee is to be paid via K-Net card.
- The final time for submitting bids is two o'clock in the afternoon on the specified day. A bid submission authorization and a copy of the Civil ID must be provided.
- A certificate of national labor percentage, valid for one year from the date of bid submission, must be provided.
- The applicant for the practice must review the practice documents and submit all questions and inquiries related to the practice in writing during the preliminary meeting. No inquiries will be accepted thereafter. In the event that any applicant for the practice is absent, they will be obligated to implement all items agreed upon during the preliminary meeting without the right to recourse against the Public Authority for Manpower for any financial claims or additional time periods.
- Attendance at the preliminary meeting requires bringing the following:
  1. The original purchase receipt.
  2. An authorization to attend and a copy of the authorized person's Civil ID.
- Bid envelopes will be opened on Sunday, 19/01/2025, at two o'clock in the afternoon, at the location specified in the practice documents, in a public session in the presence of the bidders or their representatives.
- The practice is indivisible, alternative offers are not accepted, and it follows the single-envelope system (technical and financial).
- Bids shall be valid for 90 days from the closing date. The initial guarantee is (525) K.D. and must be valid for the entire duration of the bid in the name of the Public Authority for Manpower.
- This announcement is an integral part of the practice documents.
- For more information, please visit the website of the Public Authority for Manpower on the World Wide Web.

Director General of the Public Authority for Manpower <orig>المدير العام للهيئة العامة للقوى العاملة</orig>

# Public Authority for Anti-Corruption <orig>الهيئة العامة لمكافحة الفساد</orig>
Reminder Announcement for Entities to which Persons Subject to Financial Disclosure Provisions Belong

The Public Authority for Anti-Corruption <orig>الهيئة العامة لمكافحة الفساد</orig> calls upon the entities to which the persons subject to the financial disclosure provisions, as detailed in Article (2) of Law No. 2 of 2016 regarding the establishment of the Public Authority for Anti-Corruption, belong, to adhere to the provisions of Articles (12, 20) of Decree-Law No. (300) of 2016 issuing the Executive Regulations of the aforementioned law, particularly concerning the following:
- Notifying their subordinates of the legally specified deadlines for submitting their declarations at least one month before these deadlines expire, and providing the Authority with the measures taken in this regard, for example: the two pledge forms mentioned in the Civil Service Commission <orig>ديوان الخدمة المدنية</orig> Circular No. (19) of 2020.
- To notify the Authority of the employee assigned to cooperate with it, who must be a supervisor in administrative affairs, taking into account coordination with the Authority.
- To notify the Authority with a statement of their subordinates who are obligated to submit a financial disclosure declaration, indicating their job title, grade, and the description applicable to them as stated in the text of Article Two of the Law.
- To immediately notify the Authority of anyone whose service has ended or whose status has been removed for any reason, or of any change that occurs in the previous data.
- To notify the Authority of the names of its representatives on the boards of directors of companies in which it directly contributes a share of not less than 25% of their capital, and it must notify the Authority of any change in the participation percentage or its legal status immediately upon its occurrence.
- In all cases, these entities must provide the Authority with the data and clarifications it requests. The Authority will follow up on the performance of the duties assigned to these entities in accordance with the provisions of the law and will report to the Public Prosecution <orig>النيابة العامة</orig> any violations of the provisions of Articles (26) and (45) paragraph (1) of the Law committed by them, in addition to informing the head of those entities of these violations to take the necessary action to rectify them.

# Kuwait Financial Intelligence Unit <orig>وحدة التحريات المالية الكويتية</orig>
## Announcement
### Public Practice No. (4 KFIU for the year: 2024/2025)
### Practice for the Maintenance of Network Protection Devices, Servers, and Email for the Kuwait Financial Intelligence Unit <orig>وحدة التحريات المالية الكويتية</orig>
The Kuwait Financial Intelligence Unit <orig>وحدة التحريات المالية الكويتية</orig> announces the issuance of Public Practice No. (4) KFIU for the year 2024/2025, for the maintenance of network protection devices, servers, and email for the Kuwait Financial Intelligence Unit <orig>وحدة التحريات المالية الكويتية</orig> for a period of three years. This will be conducted via sealed envelopes in accordance with the general and special conditions and specifications contained in the practice documents. These documents can be obtained from the headquarters of the Kuwait Financial Intelligence Unit <orig>وحدة التحريات المالية الكويتية</orig>, located in Al Hamra Tower <orig>برج الحمراء</orig>, 41st floor, during official working hours, starting from Sunday, 2024/12/29, for a non-refundable fee of (75 K.D.) (only seventy-five Kuwaiti Dinars <orig>ديناراً كويتياً</orig>). Please note that payment will be accepted via K-NET device only, and cash payments will not be accepted.

<table_caption>Tender Schedule and Requirements for Network Maintenance Practice</table_caption>

| Initial Deposit | Document Price | Closing Date | Issuance Date |
|:---|:---|:---|:---|
| (2%) of the bid value, valid for 90 days, in the form of a certified check from a local bank or a letter of guarantee. | 75 (K.D.) non-refundable | Thursday, 2025/01/23 | Sunday, 2025/01/05 |
| Headquarters of the Kuwait Financial Intelligence Unit <orig>وحدة التحريات المالية الكويتية</orig> at 11:00 AM. | Sunday, 2025/01/12 | Preliminary Meeting | |

- The practice is indivisible, and alternative bids are not permitted.
- This practice is open to accredited practitioners registered with the Central Agency for Public Tenders <orig>الجهاز المركزي للمناقصات العامة</orig> who meet the legal requirements and are qualified to participate in such practices to submit their bids.
- A letter of authorization in the name of the representative must be submitted to receive the practice documents, along with a personal ID, and the company's registration certificate from the (Central Agency for Public Tenders <orig>الجهاز المركزي للمناقصات العامة</orig>) and the (Chamber of Commerce and Industry <orig>غرفة التجارة والصناعة</orig>) when purchasing the practice booklet.
- A certificate of compliance with the national labor percentage, issued by the Public Authority for Manpower <orig>الهيئة العامة للقوى العاملة</orig> for the year 2024 and valid for one year from the date of purchasing the practice and submitting the bid, must be provided.
- Bids shall be deposited in the official, red-wax-sealed envelopes of the Kuwait Financial Intelligence Unit <orig>وحدة التحريات المالية الكويتية</orig> into the practices box at the headquarters of the Kuwait Financial Intelligence Unit <orig>وحدة التحريات المالية الكويتية</orig>, without mentioning the sender's name or any identifying marks. Bids shall be valid for 90 days from the date of opening the envelopes.

- Note that this is a general, non-divisible tender, such that the supply must be from the factory mentioned in the tender documents.

- As for a person who has a share in separate companies, where each company is independent in its legal personality, finances, engineers, employees, and general administrative structure, they may, upon classification, register themselves and each of their independent companies.
